Indiana Scholarships


19.54 Founders Circle
Indiana State University student who is a member of Sigma Phi Epsilon who distinguishes himself in one of the following areas:
Balanced Man (incoming freshman)
Academic Achievement (highest grade point average for each fall and spring semester)
Academic Success (grade point average of 3.4 or higher for each fall and spring semester)
Leadership Development (attending Sigma Phi Epsilon leadership development programs) more...

1St Source Scholarship For Indiana University
Employee-Related award for natural or legally adopted children of current 1st Source Corporation employees (with 3 years consecutive employment) that plan to pursue full-time postsecondary education at Indiana University South Bend, Indiana University Northwest or Indiana University Purdue-Fort Wayne. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA, financial need, community service and leadership. Number of awards and award amount varies. Nonrenewable; may reapply. more...

21St Century Book Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Indiana State University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Candidates must submit FAFSA application by March 10th. Number of awards varies. Award amount is to be used for the purchase of textbooks. Renewable. more...

21St Century Housing Award
21st Century Scholars Housing Awards are offered to first-year students who meet the 21st Century Scholars Program requirements designated by the State of Indiana, have earned at least a 3.0 cumulative grade point average on a 4.0 scale, and finished a minimum of a Core 40 diploma. This scholarship requires that students reside in on-campus housing.
Details:$1,500 ($750 per semester)
Renewable for up to three additional years
Admission deadline: May 1
Criteria must be met by May 1.
An unlimited number of these scholarships are awarded each year.
Open to Indiana residents only
To be awarded this scholarship, students must be entering ISU fall semester. All incoming freshmen who are admitted to the University by the above deadlines will be automatically considered for this scholarship. No additional application is required. more...

21St Century Housing Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Indiana State University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and must submit FAFSA application by March 10th to be considered. Number of awards varies. more...

21St Century Textbook Scholarship
21st Century Scholars Textbook Awards are offered to first-year students who meet the 21st Century Scholars Program requirements designated by the State of Indiana, have earned at least a 3.0 cumulative grade point average on a 4.0 scale, and finished a minimum of a Core 40 diploma. This scholarship comes in the form of spending authority at Indiana State University’s Barnes & Noble bookstore.
Details:$500 ($250 per semester)
Renewable for up to three additional years
Admission deadline: May 1
Criteria must be met by May 1.
An unlimited number of these scholarships are awarded each year.
Open to Indiana residents only
To be awarded this scholarship, students must be entering ISU fall semester. All incoming freshmen who are admitted to the University by the above deadlines will be automatically considered for this scholarship. No additional application is required. more...

A. Elwood & Juneth S. Adams Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Indiana State University, majoring in Education. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

A. Elwood And Juneth S. Adams Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to a student in elementary or secondary education who has earned 60 credits or more. The recipient will have earned a grade of B or better in all classes and have a recommendation from a member of the ISU faculty. more...

A. Gertrude Garrell Adams Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to a deserving student or students enrolled at Indiana State University. The A. Gertrude Garrell Adams Scholarship was established in Mrs. Adams’ honor by her husband Edwin Adams. Anna Gertrude Garrell Adams was an ISU alumna of the class of 1920.
Eligible applicants will be students enrolled full-time who are in good academic standing. Preference will be given to those with financial need. more...

Adeline & Bonnie Smith Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for residents of Indiana who are undergraduate students attending Wabash College. Selection is based on financial need. Applicants from Calumet City, East Chicago, or Hammond, Indiana are given first priority; then applicants from Lake or Porter counties, Indiana and then from the state of Indiana. Due date, number of awards, and award amount may vary. Contact the Director of Admissions for more information. more...

Adult Learner Grant
Scholarship for incoming, full-time freshmen or transfer students enrolling at Calumet College of Saint Joseph (any campus). Selection based on GPA and financial need. Applicants must be at least 55 years of age. Number of awards and award amount may vary. Recipients may reapply and compete annually. more...

(2) Full time student

(3) Financial need as determined by committee,

Allan Harrison Graham Memorial Scholarship
The intent of this scholarship is to honor the donor’s grand uncle, Allan Harrison Graham, through support for students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Systems intending to pursue a bachelor’s degree in Geology. The donor intends that only a single individual shall receive this scholarship per year.
Must be a student majoring in Geology who has maintained at least a 3.5 GPA major GPA and a 3.0 cumulative GPA; first preference given to an incoming freshman, second preference to sophomores, juniors, and seniors; financial aid may be considered. more...

Alumni Legacy Awards

Alumni Legacy Scholarship
The Alumni Legacy Scholarship is established to benefit a deserving student or students attending ISU who have an ISU alumna/alumnus in their immediate family (parent, grandparent, or sibling). The fund is established using the proceeds of memberships to the ISU Alumni Association.
Eligible applicants will meet the following criteria:
Parent, grandparent, or sibling of applicant must be an ISU alumna/alumnus; completed at least 1 semester at ISU; enrolled as a full-time student; cumulative GPA of at least 3.0; submission of resume and essay. Preference will be given to applicants with financial need. more...

Applicant must have competitive SAT/ACT scores; competitive class rank (upper 25% of graduating class); minimum high school GPA of 3.0; and letter of recommendation from an alumnus of the Department of English at ISU. more...

Archer Daniels Midland Company (Adm) Scholarships (College)
Scholarship for current/former FFA members who are undergraduate students at select colleges pursuing studies related to Agricultural Business, Management, Finance, Marketing, Merchandising, Sales, Engineering or Food Science. Student must be a U.S. citizen. Select schools are: Vincennes University, Blackhawk Community College, Spoon River College, Rend Lake College, Purdue University, University of Illinois, Western Illinois University, Illinois State University, Iowa State University, University of Minnesota, University of Missouri, Oklahoma State University, North Carolina A&T; University, New Mexico State University, University of Nebraska, Florida A&M; University, Kansas State University, Texas Tech University, Texas A&M; University, or Ohio State University. Criteria used for selection includes students GPA (minimum 3.0), leadership in FFA activities, leadership in community activities, and involvement in the Supervised Agricultural Experience Program (SAE). Nonrenewable. more...

Arlington/Roe Insurance & Risk Management Scholarship
This scholarship is established to celebrate the partnership between Arlington/Roe and ISU, and to provide support to students passionate about pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Insurance and Risk Management.
Criteria:
• Must be junior or senior in the academic year the funding is awarded;
• Must be pursuing a degree in Insurance & Risk Management in the Scott College of Business;
• Must have a university GPA of at least 3.0;
• Preference to students demonstrating financial need, as determined by the Office of Financial Aid;
• This scholarship may be awarded once per recipient and is not renewable;
• Gongaware, Networks, or President’s Scholarship recipients are not eligible. more...

Bakerman Student Research Award
To be eligible, applicants must answer all required questions and submit all required documentation in the Branch by Saturday February 2, 2022 at 2PM.
Applicants will be responsible for providing a copy of the assignment requirements, submitting a 500-750 word essay on the research/writing process and uploading a copy of the final, course-submitted version of the research paper (with bibliography). They must also request a nomination from the professor who taught the course for which the paper was written.
Additional information on this award can be found on Cunningham Memorial Library’s web page: http://libguides.indstate.edu/AnnualEvents/Bakerman
Faculty nominators will submit a letter of nomination and complete the reference questionnaire.
NOTE: All papers submitted must have been written during calendar year 2021. more...

-Recipient must be pursuing a major in one of the sciences
-First preference is an incoming freshman

-Recipient will be selected based on the rigor of his/her curriculum, aptitude on the SAT and ACT Test scores, high school activities and community service

Scholarship will be awarded to student(s) who will be entering or are enrolled in the upper division of the Baccalaureate Nursing program or the Master’s program.
General Considerations:
1. Membership and/or activity in professional organizations
2. Good academic standing
3. Cumulative GPA of 3.4 or higher
4. Financial Need
5. Preference given to applicants whose permanent residence is within ISNA District #3 (Clay, Greene, Owen, Parke, Putnam, Sullivan, Vermillion, and Vigo Counties). more...

Applicant must have membership or activity in professional and student organization. Boulet Presidents Scholarship
Annual award for incoming freshman attending Indiana State University, majoring in Business. Applicant must have a minimum high school GPA of 3.7. Selection based on difficulty of high school curriculum, writing samples, SAT/ACT scores, school activities and community service. Interview is required for finalists. Due date and award amount varies. Renewable; maintain 3.0 GPA. more...

Briggs-Chinski Scholarship In Education
Consideration for this scholarship shall be given to self-identified Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender, or Queer Indiana State University student who meet the following criteria:
Must be awarded to a student with a major in Education
Preference will be given to those who have a financial need
First preference shall be given to a self-identified LGBTQ student
Should no LGBTQ student apply for the scholarship, second preference shall be given to a student who is a member of Phi Gamma Delta fraternity
Third preference shall be given to a graduate of Huntington North High School, Huntington County, IN
The scholarship may be renewed as long as the applicant remains eligible and continues to meet the criteria.
*Renewable if the student remains eligible more...

Caroline C. Howe And Todd A. Osburn Endowed Scholarship
Consideration for a scholarship shall be given to an Indiana State University student who meets the following criteria:
Potential recipients must be a citizen of the United States (parents of recipients must also be citizens of the United States).
Potential recipients must be pursuing a major within the Scott College of Business.
Potential recipients must have achieved a status of Junior, Senior, or graduate level within the Scott College of Business.
Applicants must be engaged in part-time employment during their scholar year.
Potential recipients are not eligible for Federal Grants.
Potential recipients must be/maintain a 3.0 or above GPA within the Scott College of Business.
Preference will be given to potential recipients whose expected family contribution is no more than equal to half the cost of attendance, as determined by the Indiana State University Office of Student Financial Aid.
Preference will be given to applicants majoring in Finance, Accounting, or Financial Services. more...

Chi Omega Scholarship
(1)Recipient shall be a United States Citizen (2) Recipient shall be a woman student entering her junior year of Indiana State University, (3) Must be a full time student, (4) Must be a member of Chi Omega Sorority, (5) Must have a 2.75 GPA on a 4.0 scale and must maintain the GPA to renew in her senior year, (6) Must play an active role in her sorority and other campus activities, (7) Financial need will be considered.
In the event said Alpha Delta Chapter of Chi Omega shall cease to exist or shall have no qualified student recipients the recipient then may be a woman who is a member of a Greek fraternal or sorority organization with a local chapter recognized by ISU or if there are no such organizations then a qualified woman student, who is active in extracurricular campus activities. more...

Coach Duane Klueh International Student Scholarship
The intent of this fund is to provide scholarships to international student(s) pursuing a degree at Indiana State University and to support those students who show academic promise but require limited financial assistance.
The recipient must be an international student enrolled full time at Indiana State University. The recipient must maintain a 3.5 cumulative GPA or better. The recipient shall be a sophomore, junior or senior in the year in which the scholarship is awarded. Financial need, as determined by the Office of Student Financial Aid may be considered. The scholarship is reserved for one recipient annually. The scholarship may be renewed as along as the recipient maintains a GPA of 3.5 or higher. Recipient will complete a written letter of appreciation to the donor which will serve as their official acceptance of the scholarship. more...

College Of Business Student Excellence Scholarship
Annual award for incoming freshman who has been accepted to attend Indiana State University, majoring in Business. Applicant cannot be a Presidents Scholar, Gongaware Scholar or Networks Scholar. Candidate must demonstrate outstanding academic achievement; class rank, SAT/ACT scores; be active in extracurricular activiries; submit two letters of recommendation (one from teacher and one from High school counselor); and must submit an essay on assigned topic. Due date and award amount varies. more...

College Of Education Deans Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Indiana State University, enrolled in the College of Education. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

College Of Education Scholarship
Consideration for this scholarship will be given to a worthy student at Indiana State University who is enrolled in the Virtual Instruction Certificate program in the Bayh College of Education. more...

College Of Health And Human Services Student Professional Travel Scholarship
The purpose of the College of Health and Human Services Student Professional Travel Scholarship is to support students to travel for professional development. Such travel may include, but is not limited to
•Professional conferences
•Clinical, field work, and internship experiences
•Interviews for Clinical, field work, and internship experiences
Ultimately, support is extended so that students will be more likely to graduate from their degree programs having had important experiential learning opportunities.
Students meeting the following criteria are eligible for consideration:
• Graduate or undergraduate student enrolled as a degree seeking student in CHHS
• Must be in good academic standing
• Demonstrated financial need
• Having made a case for the use of the scholarship to support travel for professional development as it relates to achieving graduation in an essay of 500 words
• Having support and recommendation of a faculty or staff member who verifies the relevance of professional travel for the student applicant more...

College Of Liberal Arts Deans Scholar Program (Honors)
Scholarship for first-time freshmen entering Purdue University enrolling in the College of Liberal Arts. Applicants must be valedictorian/salutatorian or a National Merit Finalist. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

College Of Liberal Arts Deans Scholar Program (Sat-Act)
Scholarship for first-time freshmen entering Purdue University enrolling in the College of Liberal Arts. Applicants must have a minimum 1200 SAT or 26 ACT score. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

The intent of this scholarship fund is to provide scholarship dollars to students that show an unmet financial need enrolled in the College of Technology in good academic standing.
Eligible applicants will be College of Technology students in good academic standing with demonstrated financial need.
Scholarship may be renewable. more...

Community Charter Network Scholarship
Consideration for this scholarship shall be given to Indiana State University students who meet the following criteria:
1.) First preference shall be given to any student who attended Fall Creek Academy (FCA) or University Heights Preparatory Academy (UHP) in grades 6 through 12.
2.) Second preference shall be given to students living within the Indianapolis Public Schools (IPS) district boundaries, regardless of which school was attended.
3.) Recipient may be an undergraduate or graduate student; first preference is an undergraduate student.
4.) Recipient must demonstrate financial need as determined by the Office of Financial Aid.
5.) The minimum award is $3,000 and the maximum award is $5,000; scholarships shall be awarded until the fund is depleted. more...

Community College Of Vermont Incentive Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students transferring from Community College of Vermont to the College of St. Joseph. Applicants must have a minimum 2.0 GPA. more...

Community Service Awards
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Indianapolis. Students must have a minimum 2.0 GPA and demonstrate participation in community service. Preference given to service in religious affiliation Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Computer Science, Engineering & Mathematics Scholarships (Csems)
Scholarship for incoming freshmen, transfer students with 64 credit hours or currently enrolled undergraduate students attending Indiana State University full-time, majoring in Computer Science, Information Technology, Electronics, Mathematics or Mathematics Education. Applicants must be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident, demonstrate academic potential (transcript), submit FAFSA application to show financial need, and be an unconditionally admitted student. Due date varies. more...

Conagra Foods Foundation Scholarships
Scholarship for FFA members who are graduating high school seniors and will be attending the University of Nebraska-Lincoln, Purdue University, or Cornell University majoring in Agribusiness or Food Science. Student must be a U.S. citizen. Criteria used for selection includes students GPA (minimum 3.2), ACT or SAT scores, class rank (top 15%), leadership in FFA activities, leadership in community activities, and involvement in the Supervised Agricultural Experience Program (SAE). Financial need may be considered if applicants have equal qualifications. Renewable. more...

Creative & Performing Arts Scholarships
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Indiana State University full-time, majoring in Creative & Performing Arts. Selection requires a separate application and an audition or portfolio review. Number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Creative And Performing Arts - Creative Writing
(1) Recipient must be an incoming freshman.
(2) Recipient must have a minimum of 2.5 grade point average in high school.
(3) Recipient must declare a creative writing minor or English major with a creative writing concentration in his/her first year and maintain the minor or concentration in order for the scholarship to renew.
(4) Recipient may receive this annual scholarship for a maximum of four years.
Applicants must submit a sample of fiction, creative nonfiction, and/or poetry for review. For prose, the sample must be at least four pages, and for poetry the sample must consist of at least three poems. Applicants must also provide one letter of recommendation that speaks to the applicant’s creative writing abilities. more...

Creative And Performing Arts - Theatre
(1) The recipient must be a freshman with a declared Theater major,
(2) Recipient must have a minimum of 2.5 grade point average in high school,
(3) Recipient may receive this annual scholarship for a maximum of four years, and
(4) Recipient must also audition or interview for the scholarship. If the recipient is primarily interested in acting, the audition should be a prepared, memorized monologue. If the recipient’s primary area of interest is design/tech, he or she should be prepared to present a portfolio. If the recipient is primarily interested in playwriting, directing, or dramaturgy, he or she should be prepared to present a sample of writing and talk about theater production experiences. The Department of Theater also offers a general concentration. If that is the recipient’s interest, he or she should be prepared to audition or present a portfolio or writing sample.
Please email Julie Dixon at julie.dixon@indstate.edu to reserve an audition/interview time.* more...

Creative And Performing Arts Awards - Art And Design
Art Scholarship Competition
Qualified high-school students already accepted to ISU must possess: at least a 2.5 cumulative GPA; have completed a Core 40 or other college-preparatory high school diploma; and have declared a major in Art and Design.
Up to 8 Creative & Performing Arts Awards: between $3,000 and $6,000 annually, and renewable for 4 years will be awarded. The primary criterion for the Creative & Performing Arts Award is the student’s potential for contributing to the quality of the arts at ISU. A student must enroll as an Art and Design major. The award is forfeited if the student changes his/her major. more...

Creative And Performing Arts Awards - Music
(1) The recipient must be a freshman that plans to participate in the Music program at ISU.
(2) Recipient must have a minimum of 2.5 grade point average in high school,
(3) Recipient may receive this annual scholarship for a maximum of four years, and
(4) Recipient must also audition for the scholarship.
Please phone the School of Music at (812) 237–2771 to set up your audition day and time. If you wish to make audition plans outside of these official dates, please contact them to help you coordinate your visit. more...

The Cultural Diversity Scholarship is open to students at Taylor University. You must demonstrate exceptional leadership skills and contribute to cultural diversity to be considered for this award. Additionally, you must be an American ethnic student, international student, American who has lived in another country for an extended period of time, or intentionally engaged in a multi-ethnic community. more...

Cunningham Cultural Scholarship
Scholarship for first-year, African American, Earlham College undergraduates. Applicant must have shown excellence in academics and leadership potential in school and community activities. Additional selection criteria is a minimum SAT combined score of 1000 or ACT composite score of 22, a 3.0 GPA, and class rank in the top 50% of class. In addition to admissions application, student must submit completed Scholarship Application and an essay. Finalists must interview with admissions counselor and designates must attend the Scholars Forum. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Contact the Office of Admissions for more information and/or application. more...

Cunningham Cultural Scholarship
The Cunningham Cultural Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Earlham College. You must demonstrate academic achievement and leadership and your ability to enhance the diversity of the Earlham community to be eligible for this award. more...

The application will include a paragraph describing the student’s interests and motivation for completing a graduate degree, as well as an explanation of the pursuit of their degree increases their ability to fulfill their professional and personal aspirations. more...

Recipient must participate in Indiana State University activities to qualify for scholarship renewal each year. If eligible, a student can be awarded the scholarship for a maximum of four years. David K. Wilson Memorial Scholarship
Recipient may be an entering freshman, transfer student, or an Indiana State University continuing student. The entering student must be planning to participate on the cross country and/or track team; a continuing student must be on the cross country and/or track team. An Indiana State University continuing student must have a scholastic index of 2.5 or higher; the entering student should likewise have a similar scholastic record. The scholarship is renewable for more than one year. Preference will be given to a Vigo County student.
(In the event there is no qualified cross country/track nominee, the award, with the same criteria applicable, may be presented as baseball award). more...

Department Of Communication General Scholarship
Depending on availability of funds, the Communication faculty select students for awards in the following categories: Outstanding Junior in Communication, Outstanding Sophomore in Communication, Outstanding Freshman in Communication, Achievement in Communication and Culture, Achievement in Journalism, Achievement in Media Studies, and Achievement in Public Relations. Please provide a statement (not to exceed 400 words) in which you document your achievements in Communication and your contributions to our programs and/or university and community programs relevant to your work as a Communication major. Write to give the selecting faculty a sense of why you should receive one of these awards. more...

Director Scholarship-Taylor University
The Director Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Taylor University. You must have a minimum GPA of 2.5, and either minimum 30 ACT or minimum 1370 SAT to be considered for this award. more...

Dr. Alfred L. And Juanita R. Harding And Family Scholarship In Higher Education Administration
(1) Recipient must be an Indiana resident
(2) Preference will be given to students who are current or former residents of Vigo or Sullivan counties in Indiana or who have graduated from a high school in either Vigo or Sullivan counties
(3) Must be enrolled in the doctorate program in higher education administration in the College of Graduate and Professional Studies at Indiana State University
(4) Must continue to major in higher education administration with a career goal of working in college administration
(5) Scholarship is renewable for a total of four semesters providing the recipient remains in good standing with the College of Graduate and Professional Studies
(6) Recipient may receive this scholarship in conjunction with other grants and awards. more...

Dr. Belgen & Cecil Wells Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to a deserving student or students enrolled at Indiana State University. Dr. Belgen Wells was a graduate of the ISU class of 1940; Mr. and Dr. Wells were married in 1940 on the ISU campus. Dr. Wells held a long career as an educator. It was the desire of Mr. and Dr. Wells to leave a legacy for future ISU students.
Eligible applicants will be enrolled full-time, have completed at least one semester at ISU, and be in good academic standing. Preference will be given to those with financial need. more...

Dr. Bonnidell Clouse Research Scholarship
Annual award for graduate student attending Indiana State University, majoring in Education. Applicant must plan to conduct research that applies a psychological and/or educational theory to a problem in the educational environment. Award can be used towards research for a published manuscript, one accepted for publication, a thesis, specialist project or dissertation. Preference given to areas related to moral education, character education or values education. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Dr. Bonnidell Clouse Scholarship
(1) Recipient(s) must be enrolled in a graduate program in the Indiana State University College of Education, or have completed graduate degree requirements or have been awarded a graduate degree within the award year,
(2) Award is to be given for research that emphasizes the application of a psychological and/or educational theory to a problem in the classroom or an educational environment,
(3) Preference given to (although not limited to) areas related to moral education, character education or values education,
(4) Award will be given for research for a published manuscript (one accepted for publication), a thesis, specialist project, or dissertation, or a presentation at a refereed conference. more...

Eligible applicants will be sophomores, juniors, or seniors enrolled full-time in pursuit of a degree in traditional Baccalaureate Nursing or Nursing Completion (LPN to RN). Preference will be given to those with financial need and those who display a passion for hands-on patient care. more...

Dr. Liam K. Grimley Professional Development Award
Graduate students in the School Psychology Program at ISU for national and international travel related to professional development. Recipients of the award should honor the professional interests and values espoused by Dr. Grimley, and these include a commitment to child and adolescent development, psycho-educational interventions for parents and families, multicultural diversity, and international school psychology. For awards of $1,000 or more, recipients must submit a two page written summary about the award during the semester following receiving the funds. If no eligible graduate student applies, current faculty members of ISU are welcome to apply for the award. more...

Applicant would receive financial awards for national and international travel related to professional development. Recipient must receive $1,000 or more must submit a two-page summary about how the award helped them during the semester following receiving the funds. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Dr. Max E. Douglas Servant Leadership Scholarship
Consideration for this scholarship shall be given to a deserving Indiana State University student(s) who meets the following criteria:
1. Current student of junior or senior standing who has attained at least a 3.0 GPA with preference given to Business Management majors.
2. A student who is of high character.
3. A student who has been engaged in community service projects, with a preference given to students involved in off-campus stakeholders.
4. A student who understands the importance of ethical decision making personally and professionally.
5. A student who emulates the ideals of servant leadership as explained by the ISU Alliance for Servant Leadership as listed below:
a. Transformation
b. Personal Growth
c. Enabling Environment
d. Service
e. Trusting Relationships
f. Creating Commitment
g. Community-building
h. Nurturing the Spirit
6. Applicants must write brief statement about their ideas of servant leadership and examples of their practice of it since they have been at ISU when applying for this scholarship. more...

Dr. Maxwell E. Britton Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate junior or senior student attending Indiana State University full-time, majoring in Environmental Health Sciences. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Dr. Maxwell E. Britton Memorial Scholarship
Consideration for this scholarship shall be given to an Indiana State University student who meets the following criteria:
. Recipient must be a junior or senior enrolled full time.
. Recipient must be majoring in a field related to environmental studies, sciences, or preservation.
Key interest areas include: geoscience, environmental science, geography, and sustainability. more...

Dr. Michele C. Boyer Legacy Fund
Eligible applicants will be an ISU graduate student who is
1) enrolled in a graduate counseling program,
2) active in department’s graduate student counseling professional organization,
3) training in the Norma and William Grosjean Clinic at University Hall,
4) in good standing with both the College of Graduate and Professional Studies and with the Department of Communication Disorders and Counseling, School and Educational Psychology,
5) work should be completed or in progress for a refereed presentation on clinical issues at a regional or national conference (if no presenter applies, consideration to attendee),
6) upon return from the conference the recipient will present conference materials and experiences to the department’s graduate student counseling professional organization. more...

Applicant must demonstrate academic achievement, high character and leadership skills. Candidate must have a minimum 3.6 GPA. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Recipient shall be a worthy student enrolled full-time at ISU in the College of Health and Human Services.
Recipient must have a minimum 3.0 grade point average on a 4.0 scale.
Recipient must be entering his/her junior year. more...

-Enrolled full time as a student majoring in English
-Recipient’s GPA must be a minimum of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale

Dr. Ronald L. Baker English Scholars Endowment Scholarship
Annual award for incoming freshman student attending Indiana State University, majoring in English. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 high school GPA; or SATV 510 or ACTE 20; or rank in the upper 25% of their high school class. Recipients must prepare a paper according to the application guidelines. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Dr. Sandra Bradford Decosta Diversity Scholarship
Annual award for a minority, undergraduate junior or senior attending Indiana State University, majoring in Elementary Education. Applicant must have demonstrated financial need and a minimum 3.0 GPA. Submit one-page statement of professional goals and two letters of support from elementary education professors with application packet. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Dr. Susan M. Latta, Ph.D.
This scholarship is to be awarded to a student in good standing who is studying English as a major in the College of Arts and Sciences, has a 3.5 or above cumulative GPA, and who, according to the faculty committee selecting the recipient, demonstrated qualities similar to those of a Hazel Tesh Pfenning Scholar. This scholarship is to be a one year scholarship. The recipient is eligible to re-apply for the scholarship.
It is the Donor’s intention that this scholarship be available to any English student from freshman to senior as long as it is used only toward tuition and other required fees at ISU; an application process be used that includes written recommendations from the applicant’s English professors or high school English teachers; and preference could be given to applicants with financial need. more...

Drs. Akhtar Husain And Ismat Bano Siddiqi Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship is intended to support students pursuing graduate degrees in Geography and in the Bayh College of Education. The scholarship was originally established by Ismat Bano Siddiqi in honor of her husband. Now, with the passing of Ismat, their daughters and son would like to honor the memory of their parents’ passion for education.
Recipients must be:
- Enrolled full time in a graduate program, with first preference to students with a declared major in Geography and second preference to students in the Bayh College of Education;
- GPA of at least 3.5 on a 4.0 scale;
- Must demonstrate financial need. more...

Eaa Chapter 1354 Aviation Scholarship (Membership)
Scholarship for Experimental Aircraft Association (EAA) Chapter 1354 members who are graduating high school seniors or college freshmen enrolled full-time at Purdue University-School of Aviation, Vincennes University, Indiana State University, Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University, or University of Illinois pursuing a career as a commercial pilot, air transport pilot, airport administration, or in the field of Aeronautical Engineering. Students must exhibit good character and commitment to school and community. Selection is based on standardized test scores, GPA, and/or class rank which demonstrates academic preparation and performance. Number of awards may vary. A personal statement and an essay must be included with application packet. more...

Eaa Chapter 1354 Aviation Scholarship (Residency)
Scholarship for Johnson County, Indiana residents who are graduating high school seniors or college freshmen enrolled full-time at Purdue University-School of Aviation, Vincennes University, Indiana State University, Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University, or University of Illinois pursuing a career as a commercial pilot, air transport pilot, airport administration, or in the field of Aeronautical Engineering. Students must exhibit good character and commitment to school and community. Selection is based on standardized test scores, GPA, and/or class rank which demonstrates academic preparation and performance. Number of awards may vary. A personal statement and an essay must be included with application packet. more...

Educational Opportunity Fellowship - Iu - Bloomington
The Educational Opportunity Fellowship is awarded to full-time incoming and continuing graduate students intending to pursue a masters or doctoral degree at Indiana University. To be considered for this award, you must be of promising academic ability (even though educational and/or economic background may have hampered preparation for graduate level work), you must be a first generation college student, demonstrate acute financial need and submit a completed FAFSA along with your application if applicable. U.S. citizenship is also required. more...

Fall 2022 Career Center Internship Scholarship
The Internship Scholarship program has three scholarships that support targeted internship experiences that will develop students’ understanding of themselves and a meaningful career path. If you are completing an internship experience either paid or unpaid, apply to the internship scholarship program through the Career Center.
Each scholarship recipient will be selected through a rubric rating, upon interviewing and submitting all documents requested. With any additional questions, please contact the Career Center at 812-237-5000 or via e-mail at isu-career-center@mail.indstate.edu. For more information on internship scholarships, visit the Career Center website. more...

Fifth Third Bank, Indiana, Inc.
Scholarship for residents of Indiana from selected counties, and are FFA members and will be/are pursuing a four year degree at an Indiana university. Selected Indiana counties are: Adams, Allen, Bartholomew, Benton, Boone, Brown, Clay, Dearborn, Decatur, Fayette, Franklin, Greene, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Jackson, Jennings, Johnson, Lawrence, Madison, Marion, Monroe, Morgan, Ohio, Orange, Owen, Parke, Putnam, Ripley, Rush, Shelby, Steuben, Sullivan, Tippecanoe, Vermillion, or Vigo. Student must be a U.S. citizen. Criteria used for selection includes students GPA, ACT or SAT scores, class rank, leadership in FFA activities, advisor statement verifying participation, leadership in community activities, and involvement in the Supervised Agricultural Experience Program (SAE). Applicant must also have the application signed by the local Fifth-Third Bank Center manager. Nonrenewable. more...

Fine And Performing Arts Scholarship - University Of Evansville
The Fine and Performing Arts Scholarship is available to incoming freshmen who plan on majoring in art, music or theatre at the University of Evansville. Your selection for this renewable award will be based on your high school record. Please contact the department to schedule an audition or portfolio presentation. more...

Fine Art Scholarships (Art)
Scholarship for freshmen with talent in art enrolling at Ball State University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Selection is based on academic record and art portfolio. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Fine Arts Fellowship - Wabash College
The Fine Arts Fellowship is open to students attending Wabash College and studying visual arts, creative writing, music or theater. The requirements for applying vary with each field. This scholarship is renewable annually, provided you maintain normal progress towards graduation. more...

Fine Arts Fellowships
Scholarship for undergraduates attending Wabash College who have outstanding talent in the Fine Arts (Creative Writing, Music, Theater, and Visual Arts). Selection is based on auditions and/or work samples. Number of awards offered may vary. Renewable. Contact the Director of Admissions for more information. more...

Fingleton Scholarship
The Fingleton Scholarship is available to students at Indiana University, Kokomo. You must be majoring in accounting or business and demonstrate strong academic performance to be eligible for this award. Preference is given to students involved in accounting programs. more...

First Choice-First Choice Achiever Awards For Indiana Twenty-First Century Scholars
Scholarship for full-time, first-time freshmen accepted to the University of Evansville who are Indiana Twenty-first Scholars. Selection based on GPA, difficulty of curriculum, class rank and SAT/ACT scores. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. more...

First District Dental Society Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending the University of Southern Indiana full-time, majoring in Dentistry. Applicants must have good academic achievement and be in good standing with the university. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

First Generation Scholarships
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolling at Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis who are the first in their immediate family to attend college. Applicants must have a minimum SAT score of 1000 or ACT score of 21 and were ranked in the top 40% of their graduating class. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Annual award for undergraduate junior attending Indiana State University, majoring or minoring in Insurance. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and 3.5 in insurance courses. Preference given to Central Indiana students. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and have an interest in participating on the speech team. A $20 application fee must be included with application packet. An essay must be included with application packet. Renewable. more...

Freshman Work Program
Annual award for full-time freshmen attending Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis who are majoring in Biology. Recipients will be able to work up to 10 hours per week and have the opportunity for future placement in other positions offered by the department. Salary is $8.00 per hour. Due date and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Golden Harvest Seeds, Inc. (A)
Annual award for residents of Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, Ohio, or Wisconsin who are FFA members and are graduating high school seniors enrolling at selected four year colleges or universities and will be pursuing studies in Agronomy. Applicants must be U.S. citizens. Selected universities are: University of Illinois, Purdue University, Michigan State University, Ohio State University, or the University of Wisconsin. Student must be a U.S. citizen. Criteria used for selection includes students GPA, ACT or SAT scores, class rank, leadership in FFA activities, leadership in community activities, and involvement in the Supervised Agricultural Experience Program (SAE). Nonrenewable. more...

Selection based on students portfolio. Due date and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Helen Oppy Binns Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Wabash College. Selection is based on financial need. Preference given to applicants from Coal Creek Township, Montgomery counites, Indiana and then from Indiana. Due date, number of awards, and award amount may vary. Contact the Director of Admissions for more information. more...

Annual award for graduate student attending Indiana State University, pursuing a post-graduate course or doing research in the field of Education. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students attending the University of Southern Indiana full-time. Applicants must have outstanding academic achievement. Award is to be used for textbooks. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Scholarship for Indiana residents who are undergraduate students attending the University of Southern Indiana full-time. Applicants must have a minimum high school GPA of 3.5 and financial need. Students must file FAFSA application by March 1st. Preference given to Vanderburgh County residents. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Annual award for undergraduate junior or senior student attending Indiana State University full-time, majoring in Music Education. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, leadership potential and superior ability in teaching. Financial need may be considered. Due date varies. more...

The Henry E. Meurer Music Education Scholarship is available to juniors and seniors at Indiana State University. You must be majoring in music education to qualify for this award. more...

Henry G. Reifsnyder Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Indiana State University full-time, majoring in English or English Education. Applicant must submit a writing sample, demonstrate strong academic standing (minimum 3.0 GPA) and have demonstrated financial need. more...

Herbert G. Bohn Scholarships
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolled full-time at the University of Indianapolis majoring in Chemistry or a related field. Students must demonstrate financial need and academic achievement. Preference given to students with outstanding merit. Award amount is for 25% of tuition. A $20 application fee must be included with application packet. Renewable. more...

Herbert I. & Bernice Lamb Presidents Scholarship
Annual award for resident of Warrick County, Indiana who is an incoming freshman accepted to attend Indiana State University. Applicant must have a minimum 3.7 GPA. Selection is based on curriculum challenge, writing samples, SAT/ACT scores, school activities and community service. Interview is required for finalists. Preference given to student who graduated from a Vigo County, Indiana high school. Due date and award amount varies. Renewable. more...

Herbert L. Ross Scholarship
Annual award for incoming freshman student attending Indiana State University, majoring in Business. Due date varies. more...

Honors Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolling at Earlham College. A typical profile of a recipient is: applicants who have exceptional personal and academic qualities, minimum SAT combined score of 1200 or ACT composite score of 26, a 3.0 GPA, and class rank in the top 50% of class. In addition to admissions application, student must submit completed Scholarship Application and an essay. Candidates must interview with admissions counselor and attend the Scholars Forum. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Contact the Office of Admissions for more information and/or application. more...

Illinois Student Scholarship - Fall
Illinois Student Scholarships are offered to first-year students who are residents of Illinois who have been admitted without condition to Indiana State University.
Details:
Special reduced fee (tuition) rate
Renewable
An unlimited number of these scholarships are awarded each year
Not open to international, online-only, or returning ISU students
All incoming freshmen who are residents of Illinois and admitted to the University will be automatically considered for this scholarship. No additional application is required. more...

Indiana Farmers Mutual Insurance Group
Annual award for residents of Indiana who are FFA members and are graduating high school seniors or current undergraduate students enrolled/enrolling at an Indiana university/college pursuing studies in Agriculture. Students must be U.S. citizens. Criteria used for selection includes students GPA, ACT or SAT scores, class rank, leadership in FFA activities, leadership in community activities, and involvement in the Supervised Agricultural Experience Program (SAE). Nonrenewable. more...

Indiana Farmers Mutual Insurance Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate sophomore, junior or senior student attending Indiana State University, majoring in Insurance and Risk Management. Applicant must be in good standing at ISU. First preference given to the dependent of an Indiana Farmers Mutual employee; then to a dependent of a licensed agency employee who represents Indiana Farmers Mutual in good standing. If no eligible applicants apply, then award will go to deserving student majoring in Insuance. Due date varies. more...

Applicants must have a minimum 3.25 overall GPA, a minimum 3.75 GPA in major coursework and completed the introductory physical and historical geology courses. Number of awards may vary. Indiana National Guard Supplemental Grant
Scholarship for active Indiana Air and Army National Guard members who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Ball State University (all campuses), Indiana State University, Indiana University, Ivy Tech State College, Purdue University, University of Southern Indiana, or Vincennes University. Students must be high school graduates, home-schooled, or GED recipients, and be residents of Indiana since December 31st of the previous year. A FAFSA must be submitted by March 10th. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

An essay must be included with application packet. more...

International Scholar Award - Fall
International Scholar Awards are offered to first-year international students who have at least a 3.0 cumulative grade point average on a 4.0 scale in high school. Details:
$5,000 a year
Renewable for up to three additional years
Admission deadline: July 15 for fall
Criteria must be met by July 15 for fall
An unlimited number of International Scholar Awards are given each year
Open only to international students who are not fully sponsored
Not open to United States citizens or permanent residents, online-only students, or returning ISU students
All incoming freshmen who are admitted to the University by July 15 for fall will be automatically considered for this scholarship. No additional application is required. more...

International Scholar Award - Spring
International Scholar Awards are offered to first-year international students who have at least a 3.0 cumulative grade point average on a 4.0 scale in high school.
Details:
$5,000 a year
Renewable for up to three additional years
Admission deadline: July 15 for fall
Criteria must be met by July 15 for fall
An unlimited number of International Scholar Awards are given each year
Open only to international students who are not fully sponsored
Not open to United States citizens or permanent residents, online-only students, or returning ISU students
All incoming freshmen who are admitted to the University by July 15 for fall will be automatically considered for this scholarship. No additional application is required. more...

Iub-Leesa Wilson Goldmuntz Scholarship (Iu Student Foundation)
Awarded annually to two undergraduate students who have demonstrated active participation in the IU Student Foundation, are a senior, and have demonstrated leadership qualities and academic merit, as well as being committed to IUSF goals and purposes. Because, as part of its mission, Indiana University is committed to diversity, special consideration will be given to underrepresented populations, including but not limited to financially challenged students, and/or students with diverse cultural experiences. The scholarship will be awarded to one female and one male student. more...

Iun-Lloyd A. Rowe Public Affairs Scholarship
Support undergraduate and graduate scholarships for students pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Public Affairs or Master of Public Affairs degree in the School of Public and Environmental Affairs. Recipient(s) must be in good academic standing and be interested in a career in public administration as determined by the Scholarship Committee. Preference will be given to recipient(s) with a concentration in public management, particularly those who are pursuing, or are presently engaged in, a career in general purpose local government and who have demonstrated financial need in accordance with the Office of Financial Aid policies and procedures. more...

Iupuc-Dreamer Scholarship
It is the intent of the Donors, and the Foundation agrees, that these gifts be used to support scholarships for undergraduate and/or graduate students enrolled at Indiana University Purdue University Columbus who have a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. more...

Iupuc-Familia Souza Scholarship
It is the intent of the Donors, and the Foundation agrees, that these gifts be used to supports undergraduate scholarship for student s enrolled at Indiana University Purdue University Columbus who have a minimum GPA of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale. Because, as part of the mission, Indiana University is committed to diversity, special consideration will be given to underrepresented populations, including but not limited to financially challenged students, and/or student with diverse cultural experiences. The Donors have a first preference for students who do not qualify for federal or state-based financial aid because of their citizenship status, such as undocumented and/or specifically documented students, refugees, and /or student who have been granted political asylum and were born in Mexico, Honduras, Guatemala, El Salvador, Nicaragua and a second preference for students of Hispanic/Latino descent. The scholarship will be a minimum of $500. The number, amount(s), and recipient(s) of the Scholarship will be determined by the Scholarship Committee of IUPUC more...

Iupui Distinguished Scholars

Iupui-A Rebekah Fisk Scholarship (Dental)
Given to students enrolled in the Indiana University School of Dentistry. more...

Iupui-Academic Achievement Award For Communication Studies - Doctorate (Liberal Arts)
The Department of Communication Studies presents this award to a Ph.D. candidate in Health Communication. The recipient will be a student pursuing their doctorate in Health Communication, must have demonstrated excellence in the field, made outstanding contributions to the department, have a superior grade point average, and have the support of the faculty. The Communication Studies faculty nominate and select the recipient for this award; there is no student application. If you wish to be considered for this award, please discuss your eligibility with your faculty advisor during the month of February. more...

Iupui-Academic Achievement Award For Communication Studies - Grad (Liberal Arts)
The Department of Communication Studies presents this award to a graduating student who is receiving a Masters in Applied Communication. The recipient must be a graduate student pursuing the Masters in Applied Communication, has demonstrated excellence in the field, made outstanding contributions to the department, achieved a superior grade point average, and have the support of the faculty. This award is faculty nominated and selected; there is no student application. If you wish to be considered for this award, please discuss your eligibility with your faculty mentor during the month of February. more...

Iupui-Academic Achievement Award For Communication Studies - Ugrd (Liberal Arts)
The Department of Communication Studies presents this award to a graduating senior in Communication Studies. The recipient must demonstrate excellence in the field, have made outstanding contributions to the department, have achieved a superior grade point average, and have the support of the faculty. The department’s faculty nominate and select this award recipient; there is no student application. If you wish to be considered for this award, please discuss your eligibility with your faculty mentor during the month of February. more...

Iupui-Academic Achievement Award For Geography Graduate (Liberal Arts)
The Geography Department honors a graduating master student for their excellence in geographic studies and for outstanding service to the department.
Recipient will be majoring in Geography and have a GPA greater than or equal to 3.75/4.0 scale. The department bases its selection on superior scholastic achievement, faculty recommendations, and special contributions to the Geography program. more...

Iupui-Academic Achievement Award For Geography Ugrd (Liberal Arts)
The Geography Department honors a graduating senior for their excellence in geographic studies and for outstanding service to the department.
Recipient will be majoring in Geography and have a GPA greater than or equal to 3.75/4.0 scale. The department bases its selection on superior scholastic achievement, faculty recommendations, and special contributions to the Geography program. more...

Iupui-Academic Achievement Award For Medical Humanities And Health Studies (Liberal Arts)
The Medical Humanities and Health Studies Program honors an outstanding graduating senior within the major who has demonstrated consistent excellence in the program. more...

Iupui-Academic Achievement Award For Philosophy (Liberal Arts)
The faculty of the Philosophy Department grant this award to recognize the outstanding undergraduate philosophy major in the graduating class.
Recipient will be pursuing a degree in the Department of Philosophy. A GPA great or equal to 3.5 out of a 4.0 scale is required. The department bases its selection on superior scholastic achievement, faculty recommendations, and active engagement with the Department of Philosophy.
No student applications accepted. Faculty nominated and selected.
Nominated students will be asked by a faculty member to submit a short statement of purpose. more...

Iupui-Academic Achievement Award For Sociology (Liberal Arts)
This award recognizes a graduating senior sociology major who has demonstrated the highest level of excellence in the study of Sociology.
This award is open to all Sociology seniors who have taken at least seven (7) sociology courses at IUPUI, has a GPA greater or equal to 3.5 out of a 4.0 scale for IU sociology courses, and has graduated or expected to graduate in the academic year the award is granted. The students must be nominated by a Sociology faculty member who has taught the student or supervised his/her work. The department bases its final selection on superior scholastic achievement and special contributions to the Sociology Department.
No student application needed. Faculty nominated and selected.
Nominated students will receive an email notification requesting additional infomation to be completed utilizing the One.IU scholarship management system." more...

Iupui-Adah Broadbent Scholarship (Herron)
Established in 1990 by Dr. Mary Broadbent Platz in honor of her sister- an author and lifelong teacher. Awarded to outstanding students in fine arts, painting, or visual communication design. more...

Iupui-Adam Hayden Philosophy Scholarship (Liberal Arts)
Adam Hayden aimed to cultivate professoinal interest in philosophy. Adam hoped that students find their own lives enriched by the study of philosophy, event when those skills are put in service of seeing their way through personal struggle, as Adam has done. The Adam Hayden Philosophy Scholarship supports undergraduate and/or graduate students enrolled in the Department of Philosophy at the School of Liberal Arts who demonstrate academic excellence in philosophy.
Recipients will be pursuing a degree in philosophy. A GPA greater or equal to 3.5 out of a 4.0 scale is required. Additionally, the applicant must demonstrte their aim to cultivate professional interest in the discipline of Philosophy. The department bases its selection on superior scholastic achievement, faculty recommendations, and active engagement with the Department of Philosophy.
No student application needed. Faculty nominate and select the recipient.
Nominated students will receive an email notification requesting additional information is completed utilizing the One.IU scholarship management system. more...

Iupui-Alfred R. And Janet H. Potvin Outstanding Student Leader And Scholar Award - Soet (Engineering And Technology)
Student must:
be enrolled at the School of Engineering and Technology, IUPUI.
be a Senior (within 30 hours of graduation) with a major in a B.S. degree program or a graduate student (within 10 hours of a M.S. degree or one year of a Ph.D. degree) at the time the award is given.
have completed 45+ undergraduate or 21+ graduate credit hours at IUPUI at the time the award is given.
be an officer in one or more student organizations or activities with a strong record of accomplishments, leadership, and collegial relations.
have a cumulative IUPUI GPA in the top quarter of students in the same degree program, with a minimum GPA of 3.2.
**Scholarship is renewable. more...

Iupui-Alice Chandler Gockley And Gordon E. Gockley Memorial Scholarship (Liberal Arts)
This scholarship honors the memory of Alice Chandler Gockley and Gordon E. Gockley, both alumni of Indiana University. Alice earned her M.A. in History in 1955 and Gordon earned his M.A. and Ph.D. in German in 1954 and 1963. Alice was an avid lifelong reader and book collector and a former school librarian who placed a high value on education. Gordon was a man of arts and letters, a gourmet cook, lover of opera and Shakespeare, and a professor of German at Mott Community College in Flint, MI for more than 30 years. He was dedicated to student learning and believed his life was changed by the international study abroad experience he had during his undergraduate years.
The Alice Chandler Gockley and Gordon E. Gockley Memorial Scholarship supports undergraduate students for international study. The recipients must be enrolled in the School of Liberal Arts and will have been accepted to an accredited international stud program or enrolled in a Liberal Arts course that contains and international component that requires travel outside of the United States. The recipient should have demonstrated financial need, as determined by standard university measures.
Applicants will need to submit a faculty letter of recommendation, study abroad information flyer including description of program and costs, and write an essay about study abroad plans, interest in language/culture study, future education and career plans and the importance of the study abroad program to you Liberal Arts education. (maximum 500 words) more...

Iupui-Alpha Blackburn Scholarship For The Arts (Herron)
The Alpha Blackburn Scholarship for the Arts was established in 2013 to support undergraduate scholarships for full-time incoming freshmen enrolled in any area of study at Herron School of Art and Design. The recipient must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and demonstrate outstanding talent, as determined by Herron faculty. Special consideration will be given to underrepresented populations including, but not limited to, financially challenged students and/or students with diverse cultural experiences. Preference will be given to African American students who demonstrate financial need. Applicants must submit a portfolio of artwork in order to be considered for this award.
Because, as part of its mission, Indiana University is committed to diversity, special consideration will be given to underrepresented populations, including but not limited to financially challenged students, and/or students with diverse cultural experiences. more...

Iupui-Amber Curtis Pratcher Memorial Scholarship
The Amber Curtis Pratcher Memorial Scholarship is awarded to a member of Student African American Sisterhood (SAAS). The recipient must be an active member of SAAS (based on participation in meetings, service and programs), have a minimum 2.5 GPA and be enrolled full-time at IUPUI. The scholarship winner must uphold the legacy of Amber Pratcher who was committed to women of color, innovation, and leadership. more...

Iupui-Andy Jacobs, Jr. Memorial Scholarship (Liberal Arts)
This scholarship celebrates the life and memory of a remarkable public servant, citizen, veteran, teacher, friend, husband, and father. He was a Democrat who served the central Indiana district in the U.S. House of Representatives for 30 years and who later brought his commitment to democracy to the classroom as an adjunct faculty member in political science in the IU School of Liberal Arts at IUPUI. This scholarship was created to recognize the potential of all students to make important contributions to our community and nation.
The Andy Jacobs, Jr. Memorial Scholarship provides an annual scholarship for an undergraduate student enrolled in the IU School of Liberal Arts at IUPUI. The recipient may be a full-time or part-time student, must be in good academic standing (although recipient selection should not be based on academic achievement or performance), but demonstrated financial need and a demonstrated thirst for justice and a passion for addressing social concerns in an innovative and compassionate manner. Note: The statement will be made in the format of a podcast in which the student communicates his or her ideas and motivation(s) and how he/she relates this passion to his/her educational pursuits. The selection committee sill place priority on the applicants’ oral communication skills. Students will also be required to share the podcast. more...

Iupui-Angela Hazlewood Murat, Dds Memorial Scholarship (Dental)
Given annually to students enrolled in their 3rd year of the doctorate of dental surgery degree program at the School of Dentistry and be a leader and or volunteer. Preference will be given to students representing the north Central District Dental Society which comprises Elkhart, St. Joseph, Kosciusko or Marshall Counties. more...

Iupui-Anita H. Slominski Ot Fellowship (Health & Human Sciences)
This fellowship is used to support graduate fellowships. Income from this gift be used to support graduate fellowships, with preference being given to a first year OT student with demonstrated financial need. more...

Professor Anna K. Suter was an advocate for students, promoting academic success and encouraging many students to persist and achieve their degree objectives. This scholarship was established in her memory to support full-time undergraduate students, thus ensuring that the next generation of mathematicians would be recognized for their achievements. Recipients must be enrolled in a School of Science mathematics program.
Recipient must be enrolled in the IUPUI Purdue School of Science. more...

Iupui-Associated General Contractors Of Indiana Scholarship - Cm (Engineering And Technology)

be enrolled at the School of Engineering and Technology, IUPUI.
be pursuing a certificate or degree in Construction Engineering Management Technology in the Department of Engineering and Technology.

Iupui-Audrey Harshbarger Study Abroad Scholarship (Liberal Arts)
Created to honor the memory of Audrey Harshbarger, Jean Belle’s grandmother, whose belief and faith in young people and commitment to their learning through experience has inspired many to further Indiana University’s mission and to encourage others to give to Indiana University. This award seeks to support students who study abroad because that experience develops a person’s understanding of our place in a global society, and the donors believe that this experience is integral to a person’s education.
Eligible candidates will be undergraduate students majoring or minoring in a Liberal Arts discipline and enrolled in an accredited study abroad program for a semester or yearlong academic program (summer programs are not eligible).
Eligible students must be:
Enrolled for academic credit, and the program in which they are enrolled must be a part of the student’s undergraduate program of study.
Student must have a minimum 2.72 GPA out of a 4.0 scale.
Credit must be agreed upon with the department or program and placed in the student’s record before departure.
Expenditures may include, but are not limited to, reasonable living expenses, and/or travel to and from the program site and may not exceed one third of those expenses.
Selection will be made by a committee of based on:
applicant’s academic record
an essay on the reasons the study abroad program will positively impact their academic and professional goals (maximum 500 words).
a letter of recommendation from a faculty member. more...

Iupui-Barbara E. And Karl R. Zimmer Graduate Scholarship In English (Liberal Arts)
The donors wish to recognize and celebrate their friends and mentors, Barbara E. and Karl R. Zimmer, who were dedicated, generous, and long-standing advocates of Liberal Arts education adn particularly of the importance of language education and learning. Barbara Zimmer, a faculty member, played a central role in the development of the curriculum for English for non-native speakers at IUPUI. Karl Zimmer was a long-time board member and chair of the International Center for Intercultural Communication at IUPUI and has been recognized for his service to Indiana University with a honory doctorate of humane letters.
This scholarship supports students enrolled in the Department of English graduate program in applied linguistics or TESOL in the School of Liberal Arts at IUPUI who have a record of academic excellence. Preference will be given to graduate students in English applied linguistics affiliated with the International Center for Intercultural Communication (ICIC) at IUPUI. Faculty nominate and select this scholarship’s recipient; no student applications are accepted. Nominated students will be asked by a faculty member to submit a short statement of purpose. more...

Iupui-Barbara L. Wilcox Scholarship (School Of Education)
Awarded to a student enrolled in the School and pursuing teacher certification who can demonstrate financial need. Must have a 3.0 GPA. Special consideration shall be given to minority students. Students who receive the scholarship for their junior year shall be eligible to apply again for their senior year, so long as they remain qualified. more...

Iupui-Barbara White Thoreson Scholarship (Liberal Arts)
This scholarship supports Liberal Arts students who are pursuing futures in teaching. The scholarship honors the memory of Barbara White Thoreson, whose devotion to teaching and to the students she taught inspired a love for learning in those who knew her.
Eligible recipients must be pursuing a degree in Liberal Arts but may also have a double major with education or be pursuing some other certification as a teacher.
Each application must include an essay that includes a description of the applicant’s educational program/certification plans/preparation for a career in teaching and addresses how this opportunity will benefit the student’s personal and career goals. (maximum 500 words)
Additional eligible expenditures may be included with this scholarship. Students may choose to use the supplemental money as additional scholarship funds or for activities which enrich the recipients’ educational experiences and further their goal of becoming a professional educator (activities may include, but are not limited to, study abroad, conference attendance, research projects, and funded internships). more...

Iupui-Beaudry Summer Scholarship For French And Francophone Studies (Liberal Arts)
James G. Beaudry was an Assistant Professor of French in the IU School of Liberal Arts at IUPUI. His academic interests were the ""Essais"" of Montaigne and French-speaking Candadian literature and civilization.
Believing that the study of a foreign language must include immersion in the culture, Beaudry and his wife, Agnes, have long been propoents of study abroad experience for their students. Professor Emeritus Beaudry endowed the Beaudry Summer Scholarship for French and Francophone Studies, as well as provided additional funds to renovate space to create a language resource center, known as the Beaudry Resource Center. Professor Emeritus Beaudry and his wife also established a planned gift to create a second scholarship, the Beaudry Scholarship for Prospective French Teachers, to allow students to study their craft in French universities. In recognition of their extraordinary generosity, Professor Emeritus James G. Beaudry received the IUPUI Spirit of Philanthropy Award in 2003. The Beaudry Summer Scholarship Fund for French and Francophone Studies promotes and encourages the cultural and linguistic development of IUPUI students majoring or minoring in French by providing scholarship support for the student to participate in an IU-accredited study abroad program in an French-speaking country during the summer session.
Preference will be given to an undergraduate French major in the IU School of Liberal Arts at IUPUI. If no eligible major applies, the scholarship may be awarded to a student pursuing a French minor.
Essay: Write a 250-word essay that must include: your foreign study plans, your interest in French-speaking culture(s), the importance of your foreign study in your Liberal Arts education, information about your projected foreign study program (location, dates, costs).
Essays should be typed and double-spaced. Please do not include your name on the essay. Attach a cover sheet which includes your name and email address. Submit electronically as part of the application online.
A committee composed of the coordinator of French in the Department of World Languages and Cultures and all full-time faculty teaching French at IUPUI will review the applications and decide the student recipient. more...

Iupui-Bepko Scholarship In Biomedical Engineering - Bme (Engineering And Technology)
Student must:
be enrolled at the School of Engineering and Technology, IUPUI.
be enrolled in the Biomedical Engineering program.
have a high GPA. more...

Iupui-Bersier World Language Scholarship (Liberal Arts)
Created by Professor Emerita Gabrielle Bersier who wished to advance the study of world languages and cultures by students and recognize student achievement and potential, this scholarship supports an undergraduate student who is enrolled part-time or full-time, majoring in the Department of World Languages and Cultures, or is enrolled in the Individualized Major Program with a world language concentration, and who has a record of academic excellence.
Applicant must have at least one year of study until graduation. Preference will be given to a student who has demonstrated service to their language discipline. Selection will be based on a rotation among the existing language programs. To be considered, students will request a letter of recommendation from a Liberal Arts faculty member and write an essay of 250 words that explains interest in the language and describes service to the language discipline. more...

Preference for this award is given to a student who has done exceptional work in film criticism and research in upper-level film studies courses during the past year. Faculty nominate and select the recipient of this scholarship; no student applications are accepted. more...

Iupui-Boone Family Dds Scholarship (Dental)
This scholarship is to support third or fourth year graduate students in the Pre-Doctoral program within the School of Dentistry at IUPUI who have demonstrated an improved GPA following their freshmen year and have continued to show improved scholastic performance with a minimum GPA of 3.0, and have demonstrated financial need.
First preference will be given to students who are Indiana residents, ranked in the middle of their class, and show an interest in the post-doctoral program of Prosthodontics at IUPUI.
Second preference will be given to students who are Indiana residents and ranked in the middle of their class.
Scholarship may be renewed provided the recipient continues to have a minimum GPA of 3.0. more...
