Iupui-Brian Mcdonald Legacy Scholarship In Literature (Liberal Arts)
“The donors wish to honor students who best exemplifies the same values as Senior Lecturer Emeritus Brian C. McDonald, who lived an examined life with great integrity. These values shaped his enthusiasm for intellectual engagement and his deep love of literature.
This scholarship is to support IUPUI undergraduate students who have taken one or more literature courses offered by the English Department in the IU School of Liberal Arts at IUPUI. Preference will be given to student with good academic standing who are pursuing a degree in the School of Liberal Arts.
No student application. Faculty nominated and selected.
Nominated students will receive an email notification requesting additional information to be completed by utilizing the One.IU scholarship management system. more...

Iupui-Buhner2 Scholarship For Student Veterans (Liberal Arts)
Founded in recognition and celebration of members of America’s armed forces to provide student veterans majoring in Liberal Arts disciplines with support to obtain their degrees and move toward accomplishing their professional and personal goals.
You will need to submit an essay describing your past military and/or community service and how you plan to use your degree to help shape your contributions to American society. (maximum 500 words) more...

Iupui-Carlin Award For Outstanding Graduate Student Paper In Empirical Economics (Liberal Arts)
The Carlin Award for an Outstanding Graduate Student Paper in Empirical Economics was created to honor Professor Emeritus of Economics, Paul Carlin. Dr. Carlin’s research examined many areas from the academic wage structure by gender to finding a significant link between motor vehicle dependence and obesity in OECD countries. As former Department Chair, Dr. Carlin made many contributions to the Department of Economics during his time at IUPUI especially in the areas of human resources, labor economics and experimental economics.
The recipient of the Carlin Award will be enrolled in the graduate program of the Department of Economics within the School of Liberal Arts. The recipient will have written an outstanding paper in the area of empirical economics. This award is faculty nominated and selected; there are no student applications. If you wish to be considered for this award, please discuss your eligibility with your faculty member during the month of February. more...

Iupui-Center For Research On Inclusion & Social Policy Fellowship (Crisp) (O’neill Spea)
The Center for Research on Inclusion & Social Policy (CRISP) Evaluation Clinic is looking for students to serve as CRISP Clinic Fellows for Spring 2021. Fellows will work with Indianapolis community organizations to conduct original community-engaged research or evaluation. Fellows will work in teams to learn about local issues and support community organizations. Fellows will: Meet once a week to receive relevant trainings and provide project updates. Provide a short summary of their findings to the community partner. Submit a brief reflection paper. Average about 10 hours per week with the CRISP Clinic. This opportunity is open for credit for internships or directed research.
Interested students must also complete the CRISP Evaluation Clinic Fellow application.
Scholarships/Fellowships are limited but available. more...

Iupui-Cohen Family Scholarship (School Of Education)
The scholarships benefactor, Dr. Michael Cohen, was inspired by his major professor, Verne N. Rockcastle at Cornell University, in manner similar to that of Charles R. Ault Jr. The following quote from Ault’s book Challenging Science Standards: A Skeptical Critique of the Quest for Unity, is particularly relevant. It states “My principle mentor, Verne N. Rockcastle, revealed how to find fascination everywhere and turn it to educational advantage. ‘Rocky’ taught me to be doggedly persistent in the connection of concepts to experiences.” This quote encompasses how Michael feels one should approach teaching.This gift be used to support an annual scholarship for an undergraduate or graduate student enrolled in the School of Education who demonstrates how he/she finds fascination everywhere and turns it to educational advantage and how he/she is doggedly persistent in the connection of concepts to experiences as determined by the Scholarship Committee. The Scholarship may be renewed provided that the recipient remains enrolled in the School. The amount and recipient of the Scholarship will be determined by the Scholarship Committee of the School. more...

Iupui-Commitment To Education Scholarship (Engineering And Technology)
Recipient must be an undergraduate student at the School of Engineering and Technology, IUPUI, majoring in Computer Information Technology who have a minimum GPA of 2.0 on a 4.0 scale, have demonstrated financial need, and are junior or seniors. Special consideration will be given to underrepresented populations. Preference given to African American students. more...

Iupui-Communication Studies Scholarship (Liberal Arts)
This scholarship recognizes an outstanding student majoring in Communication Studies and enrolled in the IU School of Liberal Arts at IUPUI.
Selection Criteria:
You must be an enrolled student majoring in Communication Studies in the IU School of Liberal Arts at IUPUI.
Preference will be given to those students who have a record of academic excellence and shows financial need.
You must have junior or senior status with at least 12 credit hours remaining to complete.
You must have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 with at least a 3.0 GPA in your major.
You must submit a 1-2 double-spaced essay on the importance of earning the IUPUI Communication Studies Scholarship and how it will help you pursue your academic and career goals. more...

Iupui-Constance Brown Memorial Fellowship (Health & Human Sciences)
This fellowship is given to one or two outstanding students demonstrating financial need. more...

Iupui-Cornelia Mckay Scholarship (Herron)

Iupui-Creative Nonfiction Writing Award (Liberal Arts)
This award is presented to an undergraduate student demonstrating excellence in an English creative nonfiction piece. The recipient must be in good academic standing.
Work entered in this contest should come from true, real-life experiences or situations and may not be entered in the Essay Award, the Eric Sharp Gateway Fiction Award, the Rebecca Pitts Fiction Award, or the Mary Louise Rea Short Story Award. Works written in W207, W301, and W401 may not be submitted for this award.
Do not put your name on any submitted manuscript. You may submit up to two (2) essays. more...

Iupui-Cummins Inc. Rise Scholasrhip - Soet (Engineering And Technology)
Student must:
be enrolled in the School of Engineering and Technology, IUPUI.
be an undergraduate student.
be enrolled in the Mechanical Engineering Program or the Electrical Engineering Program.
Special consideration will be given to underrepresented populations, including but not limited to, financially challenged students, and/or students with diverse cultural experiences.
A list of eligible students will be provided by the Division of Enrollment Services, IUPUI.
Because, as part of its mission, Indiana University is committed to diversity, special consideration will be given to underrepresented populations, including but not limited to financially challenged students, and/or students with diverse cultural experiences. more...

Iupui-Cvr Barrier Busting (Liberal Arts)
It is the intent of the Donor, and the Foundation agrees, that this gift be used to support undergraduate scholarships for full-time sophomores, juniors, seniors pursuing a major in communication studies, journalism, applied theater, television, and film studies, or public relations in the School of Liberal Arts or graphic design in other schools on the IUPUI campus. Because, as part of its mission, Indiana University is committed to diversity, special consideration will be given to underrepresented populations, including but not limited to financially challenged students, and/or students with diverse culture experiences. The Donor has a preference for students who identify as Black, Indigenous and people of color (“BIPOC”) or other historically marginalized populations. The Donor has an additional preference for one recipient, unless the available funds exceed the student’s established need, in which case additional recipients may be considered. The number, amount(s), and recipient(s) of the Scholarship will be determined by the Scholarship Committee of the School.” more...

Iupui-D.J. Angus Scientech Educational Foundation Scholarship - Soet (Engineering And Technology)

have a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
have shown the greatest improvement in GPA from one semester to the next.

Iupui-Daniel Nützel Memorial Scholarship (Liberal Arts)
This scholarship has been established in memory of Dr. Daniel Nützel, former German professor and Director of the Max Kade German-American Center at IUPUI to honor his contributions to the German Program at IUPUI and the German-American community of Indiana. The scholarship supports undergraduate or graduate students with a proven interest in German American Studies and provides the recipient the opportunity to work in a professional internship over teh course of one semester or over the summer. The professional internship will provide hands-on learning experiences in community institutions with a German-American tie.
Eligible applicants are full or part-time junior or senior undergraduate students enrolled with a major or minor in German, or to a graduate student with a proven interest in German-American studies. Candidates must have a record of academic excellence as demonstrated by a minimum GPA of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale.
Additional application materials include:
Student’s resume and transcript;
Personal statement of interest in the field of German or German-American Studies;
Two letters of recommendation (for German Majors or Minors: one letter must be from a German professor).
Preference will be given to student interns with German language skills currently involved in non-profit organizations with German-American connections or students who have demonstrated interest in the German-American non-profit sector. more...

Iupui-David C. Bell Theory Fellowship In Sociology (Liberal Arts)
It is the intent of the Donors, and the Foundation agrees, that income from this gift be used to support theory-based master’s or doctoral research fellowships for graduate students in the Department of Sociology in the School of Liberal Arts at IUPUI. Fellowship recipients shall be judged on the quality of their master’s or doctoral proposals by a committee of the Department graduate faculty. The number, amount(s, and recipient(s) of the Fellowship will be determined by the selection/awards committee of the School.
To be considered, applicants will submit:
The approved thesis proposal, including approval date and name of their thesis chairperson
A ‘personal statement’ submitted to a doctoral program
Evidence of application to a doctoral program in the social sciences
A curriculum vitae limited to two (2) pages that emphasizes any research accomplishments since being in the MA program
Eligible applicants must have a GPA greater than or equal to 3.5 out of a 4.0 scale and must be enrolled in the Sociology Master’s Degree program at the IU School of Liberal Arts at IUPUI with at least 18 credit hours completed towards their MA degree. To receive this award, Sociology students must be making adequate progress towards their degree (e.g., no incomplete and all conditional acceptances met). Students must also have completed their thesis proposal requirements within the two (2) previous calendar years prior to the deadline and show evidence of a promising research career and anticipated doctoral study.
Additionally, applicants who demonstrate a strong understanding of social theory in their thesis proposal will receive higher consideration.
Students may only apply once. This fellowship is not renewable. more...

Iupui-David K Rubins Scholarship (Herron)
Established in 1986, the David K. Rubins Scholarship is awarded annually to incoming freshmen who will be enrolled full-time. Recipients must meet criteria that includes scholastic record, financial need, and a portfolio which emphasizes an ability to draw from life as opposed to drawing from photographs, in addition to other drawings or two-dimensional work. Applicants must submit a portfolio of artwork in order to be considered for this award. See www.herron.iupui.edu/portfolio for details. In addition to a portfolio, applicants must submit 5 examples of drawing from life in order to be considered for this award. more...

Iupui-Ernest G. Heppner Scholarship For Social Justice And Diversity (School Of Education)
Awarded to an undergraduate student who has been accepted into the Teacher Education Program with a secondary education major pursuing certification in Social Studies or Language Arts. Must have a 3.0 GPA. Special consideration shall be given to an undergraduate, non-traditional, returning adult student.
Preference will be given to students who have demonstrated:
1. a commitment to social justice and diversity in human relations and
2. knowledge and understanding of the history of the Jewish Holocaust through individual study, university assignments, or public school classroom activities.
Additional Criteria:
Write a brief essay (500 words or less) on either of the following topics:
1. “Describe your personal and professional commitment to social justice and diversity in public education.”
2. “Why is it important to teach the history of the Jewish Holocaust to youth in Indiana?” more...

Iupui-Incoming Spring Transfer Scholarships (Passport / Ivy Tech)
INCOMING SPRING IVY TECH TRANSFER STUDENTS seeking their first baccalaureate degree, who apply to transfer to IUPUI with an associate degree from Ivy Tech are encouraged to apply if:
At the time of completing this application you have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA;
You have completed 45 transferable credit hours upon admission to IUPUI;
You will graduate in December with an Associate Degree;
Meet regular admission requirements to be degree seeking through an IUPUI undergraduate campus-based program
Plan to be enrolled full time (12 or more credit hours each semester)
Are a U.S. citizen or permanent resident of Indiana
An official FINAL Ivy Tech transcript, with an associate degree conferred (showing awarded), is required before the end of the first semester’s funds are awarded. Request your FINAL TRANSCRIPT HERE and have it sent to IUPUI Admissions at mycredit@iupui.edu. .
The Passport to IUPUI Scholarship is renewable if the student maintains a minimum IU cumulative GPA of 3.0 and continuous full-time enrollment in an IUPUI campus-based program.
By completing this application you will be considered for one of the four available transfer scholarships listed below. You may only receive one of these scholarships.
Passport to IUPUI

Diversity Transfer
TSAP
ASAP more...

Iupui-Indianapolis Project Seed Scholarship (Science)
This scholarship was established by Dr. Rosanne Bonjouklian, a valued friend to the School and an active supporter of the Project SEED Summer Research Program for high school students. The scholarship supports former student participants in Project SEED.
The Indianapolis Project SEED offers a four-year renewable scholarship (up to $2,000) for ACS-Stipend students who have participated in the summer research program as a high school student and then enroll in the IUPUI School of Science for their college education.
The Project SEED Scholarship is intended for Indianapolis-area students who have successfully participated in Project SEED, a program of the American Chemical Society—Indiana Section. Students must attend IUPUI and pursue a degree in the School of Science with a major in biology, chemistry, computer science, environmental science, forensic and investigative sciences, geology, interdisciplinary studies, mathematics, neuroscience, physics, and/or psychology. Consideration may be given to students who pursue IUPUI degrees in engineering, technology or one of the health sciences, such as nursing and public health.
Scholarships will be awarded up to $2,000, renewable for four years pending a grade point average of at least 3.00 in maintained, to former Project SEED participants to pursue science or science-related degrees, including Nursing, at IUPUI. Students receiving an Indiana 21st Century scholarship will be awarded $1,000 per year for four years.
Indy Project SEED more...

Iupui-Informatics Bs - Online Freshman Scholarship (Informatics & Computing)
This award is available to incoming freshmen who are directly admitted to the School of Informatics and Computing and are majoring in Informatics BS – online. more...

It supports graduate students in the MPAS program with a 3.5 GPA and demonstrated community service or engagement. more...

Iupui-Iu School Of Dentistry Diversity Dental Scholarship
Given annually to two Students. One recipient will be a Doctor of Dental Surgery (“DDS”) student and one recipient will be a dental hygiene student. Both recipients will be enrolled in the School as a 2nd or 3rd year student with a minimum GPA of a 2.8 on a 4.0 scale. Annually, the DDS student will receive a Scholarship in the amount of 75% of the income earned and the dental hygiene student will receive a Scholarship in the amount of 25% of the income earned. Consideration will be given to underrepresented populations, including but not limited to financially challenged students, and/or students with diverse cultural experiences.
Because, as part of its mission, Indiana University is committed to diversity, special consideration will be given to underrepresented populations, including but not limited to financially challenged students, and/or students with diverse cultural experiences. more...

Iupui-Lawrence A. Lang, Dds, Iusd Class Of 1947 (Dental)

Iupui-Leo And Mary Durbin Family Scholarship (Health & Human Sciences)
Leo and Mary Durbin were leaders in the hospitality industry in Indiana. For 53 years, Leo, Mary, and their seven children operated the Durbin Hotel in Rushville, IN. Four of the couple’s sons followed their parents into successful careers in the hotel industry. This scholarship was created to support undergraduate scholarships to students in the Department of Tourism, Event, and Sport Management who plan a career in the hospitality industry. more...

Iupui-Lillian Charleston Crispus Attucks Scholarship
IUPUI undergraduates pursuing their first undergraduate degree, who meet IUPUI regular admission requirements or are in good academic standing and have graduated from Crispus Attucks High School, will be considered for this scholarship.
Lillian Charleston spent her career working for affirmative action progress. Prior to joining IUPUI, she led desegregation efforts at Crispus Attucks High School in the 1970s. In the 1980s, she held several administrative positions at IUPUI, including student activities officer, assistant to the dean for student services, coordinator of student research, and assistant director for the Center for Urban and Multicultural Education. In 1988, she became Affirmative Action Officer for the IUPUI campus. Charleston’s duties included overseeing efforts to improve conditions for women and minorities and investigating discrimination charges on campus. Charleston retired in 2008. Besides her efforts on behalf of IUPUI, Charleston has served as an officer and board member of several affirmative action groups, including American Association of Affirmative Action and the Indiana Industry Liaison Group. She has also served as a board member of numerous local organizations, including the Metropolitan Development Commission, the Indianapolis Urban League, the Indianapolis Chapter of Big Sisters of Greater Indianapolis, and the Association for Loan Free Education. more...

Iupui-Linda Brothers Phd Scholarship (Health & Human Sciences)
This scholarship is available for students majoring in TESM who have completed at least one academic year within the school. Preference will be given to students working in an industry-related position. more...

Iupui-Nsf Urban Stem Scholarship - Current Students (Engineering & Technology)
This application is for students currently enrolled in Pre-Engineering through University college or admitted in the School of Engineering. The Urban STEM Collaborator Scholars program is for incoming freshmen and rising sophomore students majoring in engineering who are eligible for federal financial aid. Scholars will be engaged in a variety of academic, social, and career support programs designed to increase success.
Incoming students should complete the application with the February 15th deadline. more...

The Urban STEM Collaborator Scholars program is for incoming freshmen and rising sophomore students majoring in engineering who are eligible for federal financial aid. Scholars will be engaged in a variety of academic, social, and career support programs designed to increase success.

Iupui-Olaniyan Scholars Program - Incoming Freshman
The Olaniyan (Oh-LAWN-eee-yawn) Scholars Program promotes the development of undergraduate research in the Humanities and Social Sciences (or the School of Liberal Arts) facilitated through the interdisciplinary lens of African Studies, or the study of African peoples still living in Africa and those populations scattered around the globe since slavery and colonization.
The Scholarship Offers:
The value of full in-state tuition (renewable for up to four years) to be used for tuition, fees, housing, or other costs associated with and up to the Cost of Attendance (may also be used to cover educational expenses that might otherwise be covered by student loans)
A $2,000 stipend per year
The opportunity to engage in research work with a full-time faculty member
International and out-of-state students must make special arrangements to cover the difference between in-state and out-of-state costs
The program is open to freshmen, sophomore, and junior students (you must be classified a freshman, sophomore, or junior by the university in the fall of the year that you enter the program) who meet regular admission requirements to enroll at IUPUI and who have demonstrated a commitment to academic excellence and community engagement. Students must also have achieved a minimum 3.3 cumulative GPA (on a 4.0 scale) to apply.
The program is open to students of all races, nationalities, and backgrounds. However, priority consideration will be given to students underrepresented in higher education majoring in the Humanities and Social Sciences (or the School of Liberal Arts). Applicants must also be working toward their first bachelor’s degree (dual degree students with at least one major in the School of Liberal Arts may also apply). more...

Preference shall be given to a non-traditional returning woman student.
Additional Criteria:

Iupui-Patricia Tefft Memorial Scholarship (School Of Education)
Awarded to full-time undergraduate students majoring in Elementary Education within the Teacher Education Program at the School of Education who have a record of academic excellence as demonstrated by a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale, demonstrated financial need, and a demonstrated interest in special education, literacy, or early childhood. Because, as part of its mission, Indiana University is committed to diversity, special consideration will be given to underrepresented populations, including but not limited to financially challenged students, and/or students with diverse cultural experiences. The Donors have a preference for non-traditional, returning female students.
Additional Criteria:
Describe in one paragraph your interest in special education, literacy, or early childhood. more...

Iupui-Platt Research Scholarship (Dental)
Given to a student of good academic standing in a School of Dentistry degree program who is an Indiana resident and is involved with research in Dental Materials or the broader area of Dental Biomaterials. There is to be one scholarship awarded per year, until such time as the amount available to be awarded exceeds the cost of tuition for one full year. At that time, one full scholarship and additional partial scholarships may be awarded. If multiple students qualify as determined by the Student Research Committee of the School, the recipient is to be selected based on the following priorities in the order presented: 1) quality of research presentations, 2) years of research involvement or 3) random selection.
Your required scholarship essay on the General Application must address your involvement in any research related to Dental Materials or Dental Biomaterials. more...

Iupui-Pride-Hufford Scholarship (Dental)
Given annually to at least two recipients annually in the fall semester of their senior year of dental school. The recipients should have a record of academic excellence as demonstrated by a quantity of clinical activity, clinical grade point average and skillful management of patients and their dental treatment. more...

Iupui-Prince Charitable Trusts Charles S. Peirce Scholarship (Liberal Arts)
A core motivation for creating the Prince Charitable Trusts Charles S. Peirce Scholarship is to commemorate the genealogical links between the Prince and the Peirce families. The Prince Charitable Trusts have supported the Peirce Edition Project since 1997. Charles S. Peirce’s grandniece, the late Helen Peirce Prince (1920-1998), initiated that support. The mother of Frederick Henry Prince, she was the granddaughter of Herbert Henry Davis Peirce (1849-1916), a distinguished U.S. diplomat, who was the younger brother of Charles Peirce. Both were sons of Benjamin Peirce (1809-1880), Harvard University’s leading mathematician throughout the 19th century.
This scholarship is to support undergraduate juniors and/or seniors enrolled in the IU School of Liberal Arts at IUPUI who have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and demonstrate a commitment of service to further the work of the Peirce Edition Project and Charles S. Peirce. Selection will be based on applicant’s academic record, essay demonstrating a commitment to the Peirce Edition Project, and a letter of recommendation from a faculty member/mentor. more...

Iupui-Psychology Undergraduate Community Engagement Scholarship (Science)
The Psychology Undergraduate Community Engagement Scholarship supports undergraduate psychology majors who participate in community engagement.
Recipient must be a student enrolled in the IUPUI Purdue School of Science. more...

Iupui-Robert J. Alber Scholarship Fund (Dental)
Given annual to full-time student(s) in the Indiana University School of Dentistry, including students pursuing degrees in Dental Hygiene or other areas auxiliary to the field of Dentistry. Each scholarship shall be granted for one year, but may be renewed in the discretion of the committee authorized to make the award so long as the applicant makes satisfactory progress. The recipient(s) of the scholarship(s) shall reside or have resided in the following counties of the State of Indiana: Nobel, Elkhart, LaGrange, or Kosciusko. Each award shall be predicated on the demonstrated need of the recipient with no discrimination as to sex, race, religion, or national origin. In granting the award, the recipient’s future usefulness to society and the Dental professions shall be given consideration more...

Iupui-Ruth Esther Holland Scholarship (School Of Education)
Awarded to a full or part-time undergraduate student enrolled in the School who has achieved the status of either sophomore or junior standing, majoring in elementary education, reading, or language arts, who has a record of academic excellence as demonstrated by a GPA of 3.0 on a 4 point scale, and demonstrated financial need. Preference shall be giving to recipients who have been in the upper half of their high school graduating class. In addition, recipient’s participation in extracurricular and service activities will be given consideration. Students who receive the scholarship for their junior year shall be eligible to apply again for their senior year, so long as they remain qualified.
Additional Criteria:
Write a brief essay (500 words or less) describing your intentions to pursue teaching as a profession and indicate how you plan to enhance the education of young people in Indiana. more...

Iupui-Senior Academy Freshman (Ips) Scholarship

The Senior Academy at IUPUI has established a scholarship program designed to partially support tuition and books for beginning freshmen who show the potential for academic excellence at IUPUI. The scholarship will be awarded in the second semester of the awardee’s high-school senior year for enrollment at IUPUI in the following fall semester. more...

IUPUI incoming part or full-time returning or transfer students pursuing their first undergraduate degree, who meet regular admission requirements and have a minimum cumulative 2.0 GPA from previous college credits, are encouraged to apply.
The Senior Academy at IUPUI has established a scholarship for students who had dropped out of college-level status for at least 3 years and are now planning to enroll at IUPUI in order to complete their first undergraduate degree. more...

Iupui-Sheats Family Scholarship In Urban Education (School Of Education)

Iupui-Shj Community Service Leaders (Service Learning)
As part of the IUPUI Sam H. Jones Community Service Scholarship Program, IUPUI Community Service Leaders (CSLs) is a scholarship opportunity for undergraduate students who are enrolled full time for the 2020-2021 academic year and who have previously served as a Sam H. Jones scholar.
Community Service Leaders (CSLs) are responsible for the planning of campus wide community service and civic engagement events and the mentoring of other Sam H. Jones Community Service Scholars. The program is designed to identify leaders that are best suited for leading specific events and programs based upon their knowledge, skills, expertise, and interests. View more information about each CSL position descriptions:https://csl.iupui.edu/programs/scholarships/service-leaders.html.
Additionally CSLs must:
• Maintain a minimum GPA of 2.75
• Attend the mandatory Community Service Leader Orientation in August
• Represent IUPUI in a positive manner while completing 10 office hours per week
• Complete the tasks required for the specific CSL position you are assigned. View full list of CSL position descriptions:https://csl.iupui.edu/programs/scholarships/service-leaders.html..
• Attend mandatory scholar trainings/meetings on Fridays once a month
• Act as a site leader at various campus-wide service events, including SECRET Service Day, United Way Day of Caring, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Day of Service, and César Chávez Day of Service
• Attend an overnight Service Scholar Retreat
• Meet consistently with your staff advisor and act as support staff for community service and civic engagement events and programs more...

Iupui-Shj Fugate Scholarship (Service Learning)
The Fugate Scholarship began in the October of 2006 in honor of the late Daniel Fugate, a Near West community and public school advocate, as part of a larger Learning Communities Initiative at George Washington Community High School (GWCHS). This scholarship is open to full time graduate and undergraduate students. Fugate Scholars implement various college preparatory curricula to students in grades 5–12 at GWCHS and neighboring elementary schools. Students committing to service at GWCHS must be available at least one weekday (or a combination of days) from 7:30a.m–2:30 p.m. Students committing to service at one of the elementary schools must be available to serve at least one weekday (or a combination of days) between the hours of 9:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m.
Fugate Scholars must also:
• Maintain a minimum GPA of 2.75
• Serve six hours per week for the scholarship, as defined in the program description
• Complete mandatory orientation at the beginning of the fall semester
• Be present for monthly trainings
• Record and report weekly service hours using the Oncourse drop box link
• Maintain communication with the Office of Neighborhood partnerships (ONP) through Oncourse email
• Commitment to serve as a student leader on campus and in the Indianapolis community
• Engagement in college preparatory activities at Near West and West Indianapolis schools more...

Iupui-Shj Paw's Pantry Scholars (Service Learning)
As part of the Sam H. Jones Community Service Scholarship Program, Paw’s Pantry Scholars assist the Office of Student Advocacy and Support to oversee the operations of the on-campus food pantry that provides food and toiletries to all IUPUI students, faculty, and staff. Undergraduate and graduate students who are enrolled full time are eligible to apply. There are four positions available; Chair, Vice Chair of Donations, Vice Chair of Marketing, and Vice Chair of Volunteers.
All Paw’s Pantry Scholars must:
• Represent IUPUI in a positive manner while serving, planning, and facilitating all activities
• Maintain a minimum GPA of 2.75
• Maintain ongoing and open communication with Program Director through emails, phone calls and or/meetings
• Attend semester retreats
• Attend weekly committee meetings
• Complete an average of 10 to 13 hours of service (Chair position), or an average of 5 to 8 hours of service (Vice Chair positions) each week
• Serve in the pantry 6 times per semester
• Fulfill any other duties and obligations as given by the Program Director more...

Iupui-The Distributed Drug Discovery Scholarship For Excellence In Organic Chemistry (Science)
The Distributed Drug Discovery Scholarship for Excellence in Organic Chemistry was established by a grateful alumnus of the Chemistry and Chemical Biology Department. This scholarship supports undergraduate students who have shown outstanding academic performance in organic chemistry within the classroom and laboratory, mental attitude, and work ethic.
Recipients must be a sophomore, junior, or senior at IUPUI with a minimum GPA of 2.5. Recipients must have successfully completed and passed four advanced or non-entry level courses in chemistry within the School of Science such as CHEM-C341, CHEM-C342, CHEM-C343, and CHEM-C344 or their equivalents. Instructors of Organic Chemistry will be asked for a statement of support or brief letter of recommendation for all nominated students or students who apply. The scholarship is not renewable. more...

Iupui-W. Michael And Susan L. Wells Women In Science Scholarship (Science)
The W. Michael and Susan L. Wells Women in Science Scholarship was established by School of Science Dean’s Advisory Council member, Michael Wells (IUB ‘72), and his wife, Susan (IUB ‘73), to support women in science. This scholarship supports academically strong students directly admitted to and/or currently enrolled in the School of Science. Recipients must be in good academic standing, be Indiana residents, and have demonstrated financial need. Preference for underrepresented students.
Recipient must be a student enrolled in the IUPUI Purdue School of Science. more...

Iupui-W.F. Chong Family Scholarship (Dental)
Given annually to a student enrolled in the School’s 2nd, 3rd or 4th year DDS program, with a record of academic excellence as demonstrated by a minimum GPA of 2.7 on a 4.0 scale, is in good ethical standing, as determined by the Scholarship selection committee, and who is a resident of Hawaii. In the event of a tie the student with the highest cumulative score in the Dental Material Course shall receive the Scholarship. more...

Iupui-William A. Stecher Honor Scholarship (Health & Human Sciences)
The Department of Kinesiology awards the William A. Stecher Honor Scholarship to senior physical education teacher education majors who are eligible to participate in the graduation ceremony. more...

Iupui-William K. Mcgowan, Jr. Scholarship (Health & Human Sciences)
This scholarship supports students enrolled in the TESM major within the School of Health & Human Sciences at IUPUI. more...

Iupui-Williams Dental Hygiene Scholarship
It is the intent of the Donors, and the Foundation agrees, that this gift be used to support undergraduate scholarships for students enrolled Dental Hygiene Program at the School. Preference should be given to students living in Randolph County Indiana or Darke County Ohio. Recipients should have a minimum 3.42 GPA, financial need is not a requirement. Consideration may be given to an applicant from a rural community (city or town with a population less than 14,000) if no one is from Randolph or Darke counties. The number, amount, and recipient(s) of the Scholarship will be determined by the Scholarship Committee of the School. more...

Iupui-Yuri Abramovich Memorial Undergraduate Scholarship (Science)
Established by the family and friends of Dr. Yuri Abramovich, this scholarship commemorates Dr. Abramovich’s legacy as a colleague, mathematician and educator. This scholarship supports School of Science students who have a keen interest in the study of mathematics, who demonstrate academic excellence, especially in mathematics courses beyond the sophomore level, and who show promise for a career in mathematics.
Recipient must be a student enrolled in the IUPUI Purdue School of Science. more...

Iusb Elkhart County Scholarship
Annual award for Elkhart County, Indiana resident (at least one year) that is pursuing postsecondary education at Indiana University South Bend (ISUB) in good standing. Both traditional and non-traditional students are eligible. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Iusb-Frank And Marsha Martin Scholarship
Frank & Marsha Martin Scholars are academically distinguished students with leadership potential who intent to major in business and intent to enroll in the IU South Bend Honors Program.
Qualifications include:
Minimum 3.5 cumulative high school GPA (6th or 7th semester)
Rank in the top 10% of their graduating class
Enroll in the Leighton School of Business & Economics and the IU South Bend Honors Program
Preference will be given to economically disadvantaged students with leadership potential
Scholarship award amounts are renewable for up to 4 years of full-time, continuous attendance at IU South Bend based on minimum GPA and enrollment completion criteria. Awards will consist as follows:
$2,500 annual academic scholarship (renewable up to 4 years) more...

Iusb-Herbert Presidential Scholarship
Herbert Presidential Scholars are high achieving students that display strong leadership skills through school and community activities. Consideration is also given to candidates who have maintained strong academics while overcoming personal challenges or other obstacles. Qualifications include:
Minimum 3.5 cumulative high school GPA (6th or 7th semester)
Minimum new (post March 2016 exam taken) SAT score of 1170 (Evidence-Based Reading and Writing + Math); equivalent ACT will also be accepted. per HPS IU test scores not a requirement.
Legal resident of the state of Indiana
After review of applications, finalists will be invited to interview with the selection committee.
Award amounts are renewable for up to 4 years of full-time, continuous attendance at IU South Bend based on minimum GPA and enrollment completion criteria.
Herbert Presidential Scholarship (total value over $33,000):
$6,000 annual academic scholarship (renewable up to four years)
$2,000 annual campus housing scholarship
$1,000 technology award for first year
$1,000 one time study abroad award more...

Iusb-Judd Leighton School Of Business And Economics Scholarship
Judd Leighton School of Business and Economics Scholars have academically distinguished high-school records, demonstrate leadership potential, and enroll in the Judd Leighton School of Business and Economics and the IU South Bend Honors Program.
Qualifications include:
Minimum 3.5 cumulative high school GPA (6th or 7th semester)
Graduate from a public or private high school in the Michiana region
Enrolled in the Judd Leighton School of Business and Economics and IU South Bend Honors Programs
Scholarship award amounts are renewable for up to 4 years of full-time, continuous attendance at IU South Bend based on minimum GPA and enrollment completion criteria.
$5,000 annual academic scholarship (renewable up to 4 years)
$2,500 annual campus housing scholarship more...

Jim Hartman Book Scholarship
In conjunction with the ISU Alumni Association, the Jim Hartman Classic Golf Committee is awarding one $500.00 Book Award (awarded in $250 allotments for the fall and spring semesters) to be used for books. The award is not renewable. The application deadline is Thursday, March 1, 2020.
The recipient of the award will meet the following criteria:
- The recipient must be a graduate of a Sullivan County High School
- Applicant must have 32 earned college credits and the recipient must have a minimum 2.7 GPA.
- Applicant must be involved on campus through a student organization, intramurals, Fraternity/Sorority, Community Service, ETC…
The Jim Hartman Classic Golf Committee will make the selection of the recipient from the applications of students who meet the above-listed criteria. The scholarship winner will be announced at the Jim Hartman Classic Golf Outing.
If for any reason, the named recipient does not enroll at ISU for the Fall 2020 semester, the award shall go to an alternate. more...

Kentucky Residents Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Daviess, Hancock, Henderson and Union Counties, Kentucky who are incoming freshmen attending the University of Southern Indiana full-time. Applicants must be in the top 25 percent of their graduating class, complete a pre-college curriculum, or be ranked in the top 10 percent while earning a minimum 3.6 GPA in math, English, science and social studies. Award amounts vary, based upon academic class standing, high school GPA and SAT/ACT scores. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Kentucky Student Scholarship - Spring
Kentucky Student Scholarships are offered to first-year students who are residents of Kentucky who have been admitted without condition to Indiana State University.
Details:
Special reduced fee (tuition) rate
Renewable
An unlimited number of these scholarships are awarded each year
Not open to international, online-only, or returning ISU students
All incoming freshmen who are residents of Kentucky and admitted to the University will be automatically considered for this scholarship. No additional application is required. more...

Kirby & Carolyn Risk Scholarship
Scholarship for Bartholomew County, Indiana residents who are enrolling in Purdue University, Hanover College or Wabash College. Applicant must have a minimum 2.67 GPA and may not be one of the top ten graduates of their high school class. Preference given to students who have a history of school, church or community involvement and if student is the first member of immediate family to attend college. Due date and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable; but recipients may reapply. Contact high school guidance counselor or the Fund for more information and/or application. more...

Krause Corporation Scholarship
Scholarship for female, FFA members who are graduating high school seniors or current undergraduates attending Kansas State University-Manhattan, the University of Illinois-Champaign, Purdue University, Ohio State University, or Cornell University and will be pursuing studies in Agronomy and/or Plant and Soil Science. Students must be U.S. citizens and 50% of families income must come from production agriculture. Criteria used for selection includes students GPA, ACT or SAT scores, financial need, class rank, leadership in FFA activities, leadership in community activities, and involvement in the Supervised Agricultural Experience Program (SAE). Nonrenewable. more...

Laptop/Ipad Award - Spring
Laptop Awards are offered to incoming first year students who have earned at least a 3.0 cumulative grade point average on a 4.0 scale.
Details:
Brand-new, campus-ready laptop computer with full technology support or Apple iPad.
Admission deadline: Dec 15 for spring
Criteria must be met by Dec 15 for spring
An unlimited number of these awards are awarded each year
Open to Indiana and out-of-state residents
Not open to international, online-only, or returning ISU students
All incoming freshman students who are admitted to the University by the above deadline will be automatically considered for this award. No additional application is required. more...

Marching Sycamores 3Rd And 4Th Year Scholarship
In order to qualify for the Marching Sycamores Scholarship, as well as be eligible for full disbursement of the award, the student:
Must be a member in good standing (no financial obligations) in their third year ($300) or fourth (or more) year ($600) with the Marching Sycamores.
Must participate in ALL scheduled, required performances (football games, parades, other) designated by the Director. Required performances are announced at the beginning of each semester.
Must miss no more than two rehearsals, for any reason. more...

Marching Sycamores Leadership Scholarship
In order to qualify for, as well as be eligible for full disbursement of the scholarship, the student:
Must be a member of the leadership team of the Marching Sycamores (can be in any year of membership).
Must participate in ALL scheduled, required performances (football games, parades, other) designated by the Director. Required performances are announced at the beginning of each semester.
Must miss no more than two rehearsals, for any reason. more...

Renewable
An unlimited number of Midwest Consortium Scholarships are awarded each year
Not open to nursing majors
Not open to international, online-only, or returning ISU students

Online Transfer Scholarship - Fall
Online Transfer Scholarships are offered to a limited group of online-only transfer students who have a minimum 2.5 cumulative grade point average on a 4.0 scale, are admitted to one of the following online-only programs: B.A.S. in Health Services, B.A.S. in Technology, or B.S. in General Studies, and plan to enroll in a minimum of 6 online credits.
Details:
$750 award for each term enrolled in a minimum of 6 credit hours
Renewable for a total of 8 consecutive terms
Limited number of scholarships awarded each year
All incoming transfer students who are admitted by August 1 for Fall and meet the criteria listed above will be eligible for this scholarship more...

Online Transfer Scholarship - Spring
Online Transfer Scholarships are offered to a limited group of online-only transfer students who have a minimum 2.5 cumulative grade point average on a 4.0 scale, are admitted to one of the following online-only programs: B.A.S. in Health Services, B.A.S. in Technology, or B.S. in General Studies, and plan to enroll in a minimum of 6 online credits.
Details:
$750 award for each term enrolled in a minimum of 6 credit hours
Renewable for a total of 8 consecutive terms
Limited number of scholarships awarded each year
All incoming transfer students who are admitted by August 1 for Fall and December 1 for Spring and meet the criteria listed above will be eligible for this scholarship more...

Pi Kappa Alpha Boy Scout Scholarship
Consideration for this scholarship shall be given to Indiana State University students who are members of the Theta Omicron Chapter of Pi Kappa Alpha and are in the semester following their initiation into the Theta Omicron Chapter, and who meet the following criteria:
Have obtained a minimum grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale or higher in the semester of their initiation
Have achieved the rank of First Class in the Boy Scouts of America and are therefore eligible to receive a $250 scholarship
Have achieved the rank of Eagle Scout in the Boy Scouts of American and are therefore eligible to receive a $500 scholarship
Recipients of the scholarship could receive one or the other scholarship, but not both
More than one scholarship may be awarded in an academic year so long as the amount of the scholarships awarded does not exceed the balance in the spending account
Scholarships are not renewable
The preference is not to award more than $1,000 during each academic year
In the event there are more applicants for the scholarship who have met the above criteria than awardable dollars, the award(s) shall be given to those students with the highest cumulative grade point average
Scholarships shall be awarded in the academic semester following recipients’ initiation
Applicants for the scholarship must be on-campus students more...

Annual award for active member of Theta Omicron Chapter of Pi Kappa Alpha who is an undergraduate sophomore student attending Indiana State University. Applicant must be in good standing with the chapter and ISU. Candidate must exhibit leadership qualities and potential leadership development. Due date varies. more...

Scholarship for retired persons, age 60 or older, who plan to enroll at the University of Southern Indiana. Applicants may enroll in their first undergraduate course at a cost of $25 per course plus incidental fees. Students are limited to one class and must register during late registration on a space-available basis. Proof of retirement may be required. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Scholarship competition for high school seniors planning to attend DePauw University in Indiana, majoring in Science or Mathematics. A Science and Mathematics Scholarship Day is hosted for interested students to attend. Finalists will be contacted for an interview. Due date varies. Renewable; if continuing criteria is met. Contact the Office of Admissions for more information and the special application that is required. more...

Sculpture Merit Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending the University of Southern Indiana full-time, majoring in Art (Sculpture). Applicant must submit a work of sculpture in the USI Juried Student Art Exhibition. Due date varies. more...

Security Federal Iuk-Purdue Technology Scholarship
Scholarship for Cass or Howard County, Indiana residents who are attending the Indiana University-Kokomo Campus to obtain postsecondary education. Number of awards and award amount varies. Contact the Universitys financial aid office or the Foundation for additional information and/or application. more...

Senior Academy Freshman Scholarship
Scholarship for graduating seniors from an Indianapolis public high school who will be incoming freshmen enrolling at Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and enroll in a minimum of 9 credit hours. Number of awards may vary. more...

Service Scholarship
Scholarship for graduating high school seniors planning to attend Manchester College in Indiana. Applicants must rank in the top 49% of their class, and have a minimum SAT score of 1050 or ACT score of 23. Candidate should have taken college prep curriculum in high school. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Sga-Kurt Thomas Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate sophomore, junior or senior student attending Indiana State University. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and submit a FAFSA application. Submit resume with leadership activities at ISU along with recommendation by a faculty or staff member of the University with application packet. Due date varies. more...

Shared Heritage Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolling full-time at Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis who are admitted to the Herron School of Art. Selection based on academic achievement, portfolio and potential. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Sharon Volpert Sheets Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for resident from Vigo County, Indiana who is an undergraduate student attending Indiana State University, majoring in Theapeutic Recreation. Applicant must write a brief essay regarding future career aspirations. If no candidate from Vigo County identified, then student from an Indiana High School will be considered. Due date varies. more...

Annual award for undergraduate student attending Indiana State University, majoring in Business. Due date varies. more...

Annual award for graduate student who graduated from Indiana State University with a major or minor in Music. Applicant must have been ranked in the upper 25% of their class in music, and demonstrated special talents in musical composition. Due date varies. more...

The Silvio Hein Memorial Scholarship is available to graduate students at Indiana State University. You must have graduated from ISU with a major/minor in music, ranked in the upper 25 percent of your class, and demonstrate special talents in musical composition to qualify for this award. more...

Preference will be given to residents of St. Joseph County, Indiana. Selection is based on academic performance and merit. more...

Scholarship for the spouse of eligible full-time undergraduate or graduate students attending the University of Southern Indiana. The spouse may enroll at USI at a cost of $25 per course and they must register during late registration on a space-available basis. Recipients must earn a minimum 2.0 GPA. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Stanley Scholarship
Scholarship for Indiana residents who are undergraduate students attending Indiana State University full-time, majoring in Geography, Geology or Anthropology. Applicants must be a U.S. citizen, have demonstrated ability to succeed in chosen field; refrain from the use of controlled drugs or tobacco; not participate in intercollegiate athletics; be in the upper 25% of their high school class; and maintain a minimum 3.0 GPA. Due date varies. more...

Summer Research Assistant In Astronomy
Scholarship for undergraduate students accepted to Valparaiso University who are majoring in Astronomy. Summer research opportunity for a 10-12 week period on the Valparaiso University campus. Applicants must be familiar with the use of a computer and be willing to learn and work hard. Nonrenewable. more...

Summer Research Assistant In Atmospheric Physics
Scholarship for undergraduate students accepted to Valparaiso University who are majoring in Physics with an emphasis on Atmospheric Physics. Summer research opportunity in the analysis of satellite data and modeling of trace constituents in the earths atmosphere. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Summer Research Assistant In Condensed Matter Physics
Scholarship for undergraduate students accepted to Valparaiso University who are majoring in Physics. Summer research opportunity for students interested in condensed matter physics. Research will take place at the Argonne National Laboratory in Illinois. Number of awards may vary. A stipend of $400 per week is given. Nonrenewable. more...

Summer Research Assistant In Nuclear Physics
Scholarship for undergraduate students accepted to Valparaiso University who are majoring in Physics. Research opportunity for students interested in Nuclear Physics. It is a 10-12 week program with most of the work being done on the campus. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Summer Theater Scholarship

Sycamore Basketball Band Brass Scholarship
In order to qualify for, as well as receive full disbursements of, the Sycamore Basketball Band Brass Scholarship, the student:
Must be a member in good standing (no financial obligations) with the Sycamore Basketball Band.
Must play a Brass in the group.
Must participate in ALL scheduled, required performances (basketball games, post-season tournament, other) designated by the Director. Required performances are announced at the beginning of each semester.
Miss no more than two rehearsals, for any reason. more...

Sycamore Basketball Band Drumset Scholarship
In order to qualify for, as well as receive full disbursements of, the Sycamore Basketball Band Drumset Scholarship, the student:
Must be a member in good standing (no financial obligations) with the Sycamore Basketball Band.
Must play a drumset in the group.
Must participate in ALL scheduled, required performances (basketball games, post-season tournament, other) designated by the Director. Required performances are announced at the beginning of each semester.
Miss no more than two rehearsals, for any reason. more...

Sycamore Basketball Band Scholarship
In order to qualify for, as well as receive full disbursements of, the Sycamore Basketball Band Scholarship, the student:
Must be a member in good standing (no financial obligations) with the Sycamore Basketball Band.
Must play an instrument in critical need in the group as determined by the Director.
Must participate in ALL scheduled, required performances (basketball games, post-season tournament, other) designated by the Director. Required performances are announced at the beginning of each semester.
Miss no more than two rehearsals, for any reason. more...

Sycamore Basketball Band Woodwind Scholarship
In order to qualify for, as well as receive full disbursements of, the Sycamore Basketball Band Woodwind Scholarship, the student:
Must be a member in good standing (no financial obligations) with the Sycamore Basketball Band.
Must play a woodwind instrument in the group.
Must participate in ALL scheduled, required performances (basketball games, post-season tournament, other) designated by the Director. Required performances are announced at the beginning of each semester.
Miss no more than two rehearsals, for any reason. more...

Transfer Academic Scholarship - Indiana Wesleyan University
The Transfer Academic Scholarship is open to entering transfer students at Indiana Wesleyan University. You must have completed at least 24 transferable credit hours with a minimum 3.0 GPA to be considered for this renewable award. more...

Transfer Honors At Entrance Scholarship - St. Mary's College Of Ca
The Transfer Honors at Entrance Scholarship is available to incoming transfer students at Saint Mary's College of California. You must have completed at least 30 transfer semester units or the equivalent and have a minimum 3.5 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Transfer Illinois Student Scholarship - Spring
Transfer Illinois Student Scholarships are offered to transfer students who are residents of Illinois and have at least a 2.75 cumulative grade point average on a 4.0 scale.
Details:
Special reduced fee (tuition) rate
Renewable
An unlimited number of these scholarships are awarded each year
Not open to international and returning ISU students. Not open to online-only students.
All incoming transfer students who are residents of Illinois and admitted to the University will be automatically considered for this scholarship. No additional application is required. more...

Transfer Incentive Scholarship - Fall
Transfer Incentive Scholarships are offered to transfer students who have a 3.0 cumulative grade point average on a 4.0 scale. Recipients of the Transfer Illinois Student Scholarship, Transfer Kentucky Student Scholarship, Transfer Midwest Consortium Scholarship, or Transfer Ohio Student Scholarship are not eligible.
Details:
$5,000 per year
Renewable for one additional year
An unlimited number of Incentive Scholarships are awarded each year
Open to out-of-state residents
Not open to Indiana residents, online-only students, or returning ISU students
All incoming transfer students who are admitted to the University by August 15 will be automatically considered for this scholarship. No additional application is required.
To be awarded this scholarship, students must be entering ISU fall semester. more...

Transfer International Scholar Award - Fall
Transfer International Scholar Awards are offered to transfer international students who have a minimum 30 earned credits and at least a 3.0 cumulative grade point average on a 4.0 scale.
Details:
$5,000 per year
Renewable for one additional year
Admission deadline: July 15 for fall
Criteria must be met by July 15 for fall
An unlimited number of Transfer International Scholar Awards are given each year
Open only to international students who are not fully sponsored
Not open to United States citizens or permanent residents, online-only students, or returning ISU students
All incoming transfer students who are admitted to the University by July 15 for fall will be automatically considered for this scholarship. No additional application is required. more...

Transfer Kentucky Student Scholarship - Fall
Transfer Kentucky Student Scholarships are offered to transfer students who are residents of Kentucky and have at least a 2.75 cumulative grade point average on a 4.0 scale.
Details:
Special reduced fee (tuition) rate
Renewable
An unlimited number of these scholarships are awarded each year
Not open to international and returning ISU students. Not open to online-only students.
All incoming transfer students who are residents of Kentucky and admitted to the University will be automatically considered for this scholarship. No additional application is required. more...

Renewable

Transfer Midwest Consortium Scholarship - Fall
Transfer Midwest Consortium Scholarships are offered to transfer students who are residents of Kansas, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, North Dakota, or Wisconsin and have at least a 2.75 cumulative grade point average on a 4.0 scale.
Details: Special reduced fee (tuition) rate
Renewable
An unlimited number of Transfer Midwest Consortium Scholarships are awarded each year
Not open to nursing majors
Not open to international, online-only, or returning ISU students
All incoming transfer students who are admitted to the University will be automatically considered for this scholarship. No additional application is required. more...

Transfer Midwest Consortium Scholarship - Spring

Trippet Family Scholarship Fund

Young Mens Civic Club Scholarship
Annual award for resident of Vigo County, Indiana (for at least six months) who is a minority, undergraduate student attending Indiana State University full-time. Applicant must be in good academic standing. Selection based on academic potential, financial need and commitment to community service. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Z.M. Blickenstaff Athletic Training Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Indiana State University, majoring in Athletic Training. Applicant must be in good standing. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Zeberl Family Community Health Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate senior student attending Indiana State University, majoring in Community Health. Applicant must have completed junior year and have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Preference given to students planning to pursue a career in the field of Community Health. Preference also given to students participating in professionally related activities. Due date varies. more...

Zeta Tau Alpha Alumni Scholarship
Scholarship for members of Zeta Tau Alpha who are returning undergraduate students attending Indiana State University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and participate in fraternity and collegiate activities. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Zimmerman Scholarship
The Zimmerman Scholarship is open to students attending Vincennes University. more...
